text: This restaurant I came across after trying to get into another. It has a nice bar in the middle so sat there to dine. Bar tender was nice but talked to much so service was slow for all of us. I ordered the Cesar salad which was good. Then the veal Piccata which the Veal was good but the sauce was a little thick and sweat. They suggested the fried peppers as a side dish which was really bad and as a presentation looked the part. Also they were playing a monster movie on all the tv's that line the walls and it was a scene of a guy getting his face shot up which made eating pasta interesting. I would pass on this pace.

Bottom line don't go !!!  They push the over priced specials.  Will not serve plain old tap water then charge you big time for bottled water.  And the owner says don't break my balls this is the way I cook.  Well first of all your not there cooking.  I'm Italian the food has to much Garlic and to much salt. OVER PRICED OVER PRICED OVER PRICED .  My recommendation go some where else.

My husband and I love this place!!!! The amazing food and awesome bartenders and staff you can't go wrong with stopping in here!!!! We always try different dishes and everything is amazing!!! As Vegas locals we frequent here because everyone here is so friendly and helpful!!!

I had a caesar and the bucatini with meatball.... it was good.
The sommelier was well informed and let us taste a couple of reds before we made our selection. It was a little loud but i loved the oldie songs being played and the oldie movies being shown on the lcd screens!
The employees and manager there were complete snobs. Had a drink and left, super unpleasant experience.

I stopped by this place with my girlfriend as we wandered through Paris. The food was great but the service was phenomenal. 

We had the shrimp bibsy special (shrimp with a sweet and slightly spicy caramelized coating), the chicken parmesan,  the gnocci, and dessert.  My favorite was easily the shrimp and I am definitely coming back at some point for more. 

The service was top notch from start to finish.  I was surprised every time i needed something it was already there before i could even think to ask.  It was truly amazing.

What started out as a sub-par experience turned into a fun night.  We had reservations for 7:15, and the restaurant was absolutely packed when we arrived.  We waited about 45 minutes to an hour after our reservation time before being seated.  We actually had decided to leave because we had tickets to a show and were afraid we'd miss it.  Upon discussing the situation with the manager (or perhaps owner?), he promised to make it work.  We were assigned a manager or some type of higher-up as our waiter, and he was wonderful.  Bread with oil and vinegar was served (one of the things I miss most about Italy!) as an appetizer.  I ordered the tagliatelle alla bolognese and a red wine that the waiter suggested (which paired nicely).  Our food arrived promptly, and was flavorful and authentic.  The other two people in my party enjoyed the meal as well.  We had a great time and made it to the show.  They even gave us our meals on the house!  
I deducted one star mostly because of the hostess.  She kept quoting huge parties a 20 minute wait time when it was clearly going to be over an hour.  She seemed quite inexperienced.  That aside, I would definitely go back next time I'm in town, but maybe on a night I don't have other plans.

Let me start by saying- if you want a quiet, candle lit dinner- this is not the place. Martorano's is the "go-to" place for a true Vegas experience! They have a great Vegas atmosphere- very fun and vibrant! In the middle of my dinner, a screen dropped down and played a movie scene from Austin Powers. Then a while later, there was dance music and a disco ball! 

Food was AMAZING!!! I had the Veal Cutlet Martorano- I mean the guy's name is on it- of course it was freaking delicious!!! I also had the meatball which did not disappoint, but I'm telling you- the Veal Cutlet Martorano is one of the best Italian dishes I have EVER had!
Stay away. Large portions of mediocre food, and expensive. Staff nice but doesn't make up for the food.
Fabulous.  Best Caesar salad and Carbonara I have ever had.  Excellent and attentive wait staff.  Will go again next time in Vegas

I dined with my brothers and sisters and got charged twice for the same meal !  Don't trust these people and review your bill very carefully.  The prices are high and the atmosphere way too loud to talk to your table mates.  The salad was dripping in its dressing and the food way over spiced.

Was looking for a place to eat in the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas. Didn't really want Italian but it smelt good from outside. So glad we decided to go in. We had Salad, Chicken Parmigiana and a Cannoli with chocolate chips. We shared this and had plenty of food. It was so good. It all tasted very fresh. I don't like cannoli's but this was the best I've ever tried. The service was very good as well. 
I totally recommend eating here.

This restaurant was a complete disappointment. Disappointed because it wasn't very good. Disappointed because so many people told me that they HEARD it was good. AND most of all. Disappointed because we did not go to Carmines in Caesars Palace.  

This is Vegas. This restaurant should be good for a few basic reasons. 

1. It's Vegas and it's a restaurant in a hotel on the strip.

2. It's in the Paris hotel. This is a nice hotel (for the most part) and to have an Italian restaurant of this nature in this hotel is a shame. 

3.  This restaurant is not to far from Gordon Ramsey's steak house. Have you been there?  It's amazing. If I were Gordon Ramsey I would not want to be in the same building as this so called Italian restaurant.   

OK. Enough rant. Now the facts. Here's my review. 

This restaurant su*ked!!  Plain and simple. I ordered a Cesar salad. If I order a Cesar salad at the Olive Garden I know what I am going to get. I am going to get a mediocre salad with bottled Cesar dressing. Oh.......and not only will I not get anchovies in my Cesar salad, I think most olive gardens do not have anchovies anywhere in the restaurant. But this is not the Olive Garden. This is a fancy Italian restaurant in Vegas on the Strip in the Paris hotel surly they will do a Cesar salad right?  Won't they? .............well......the answer is no. And not only do they do it wrong. They do not even realize it. The Cesar salad at this Italian restaurant doesn't come with anchovies. That is the standard Cesar salad. (I should have left at that point). But.....unlike the Olive Garden you can request them. ....  yea........When my Cesar salad came out, it came with a side of anchovies. ARE YOU FREAKING KIDDING ME. That is not how you do it. You do not add the anchovies that way. Even I know that. What a joke. 

OK. One more food item. I know I have rambled on. 

I love nochie. It is my very favorite Italian food. Being Italian my self....(well, mostly anyway) I fell in love with this dish when I was a kid and my friends mom in Upper Darby, Pennsylvania would make it from scratch when I would go to his house on the weekends. WOW!!! It was amazing. This was not the same experience. This nochie tasted like chef Boy-Ar-De  make it last March and was kind enough to put it in a can for the Cuz that runs this restaurant. It was hard. It wasn't dumpling like and tasted blan. Yuk!! 

A lot of words in this review I know. But in Vegas at a hotel like the Paris the food should be better. I have had a better Italian meal at the Olive Garden. 

Stay  away!!!!
appetizers were really good! meatball salad & mozarella stack. entrees were salty as all hell... cut back on the sodium, cuz!

I am in the Paris Hotel every weekend, so I thought I would take family there to try it. 

Very underwhelmed and can't really see what the hype is all about. 

Service slow (Sunday night in December) we ordered the Calamari as an appetizer (which was OK) and literally a minute after another waiter showed up with our Entrees! The look on his face when I asked him to come back later was priceless! 

We both had the Veal as Entrees, when It came back the second time, I was very unimpressed. It was just a piece of Breaded Veal with a thick sauce and sliced Parmesan cheese.  No Veg, no sides, nothing. 

The sauce had huge pieces of a very spicy pepper, I love hot and spicy food, but this didn't go with the dish at all. 

It's an expensive place, my wife works for Caesars ent, so we got a discount. To be honest.... There's far better Italian restaurants in Las Vegas for the same prices.

Incredible.  I was expecting good, old school Italian. But it was so much better.  Mozzarella made to order. Sunday gravy, best chicken parmigiana ever, and carbonara served with fresh egg yolk cooked into the warm pasta at the table.  One word of advice: as good as the bread and two types of olive oil (plus pecorino Romano) are, skip them.  You will want every bit of your appetite reserved for the main courses.  Definitely a new favorite in Vegas (and we live here).

4 of us just dropped $500 (five hundred dollars) for dinner and a bottle of wine. We're going to a show @7:00, so we decided we would return and have dessert after the show.  When we returned we were refused a table for dessert and drinks. Plenty of tables available. It was 9:30 pm, restaurant doesn't close till 11:00 pm. They wanted to put us at the bar with music blasting behind us. Are you kidding me? We just spent $500 there 2 hours before. 

We travel often and know tons of people that travel also.  We will NOT be recommending this place because of this treatment.  

I would think twice about putting my name on a restaurant that treats you're guests this way.

I'll start by saying that the Service was excellent.  Our waiter was super attentive and extremely friendly.

We ordered the salad and meatball as the appetizer.  It was excellent.  For the main course I ordered the Spaghetti di avolo and my finace ordered the lamb Bolognese.  Both dishes were extremely salted.  It pretty much ruined any flavor of the herbs and spices that the sauce had.  I couldn't even finish half of my plate.

The drinks were good.  Overall, the service is top notch but the food was borderline inedible.  Just like anything in Vegas, this was expensive, but I think I would have gotten something better tasting for the money we spent there.

Had a very good meal here about a month ago when I was in town on business for a restaurant conference  (Eggplant Parmigiana and a house salad).

Thought I would give it another try this week when I was back for another restaurant related convention. this time, the meal was terrible and the service was indifferent. 

The bartender raved about how great the Philly Cheese Steak was and basically told me to order it. when it arrived it was so salty it was not edible. don't misunderstand, I love Philly Steaks and I like salty food as well, but this was disgusting. After he saw I couldn't eat it, he asked if I wanted something else. I ordered a salad and decided to call it a day and chalk it up to a bad meal. However when I received the check, I was amazed to find that the overpriced $18 sandwich  (of which I ate less than half) was on the bill along with the salad.

Bottom line I will never go back. Bad food and Bad service is a lethal injection in our business.

Obscene and disgusting!  Had a reservation at 9:30.  Sat down and the volume of the music from the video displays was so loud that we had to shout at each other at the table.  Asked manager to turn volume down.  He said, "his owner wanted it that loud."  Sat back down.  Video screens switched to a movie trailer.  So now we had Eddie Murphy screaming obscenities: "c**k s****r  &  m****r f****r at mach 10 volume in our ears.  We got up to leave.  Told the manager.  His response to the obscenities was, "that's just who we are".  Really, How sad!  Went across the casino to Mon a Mi Gabi and had a great meal.

A few things

Tile on the floor is the exact same as the bathroom in my house that was built in 1905. True story,  exact same. This part is not a knock, just truth. 

Appetizer bread frozen in the middle,  what the heck

Pasta subsitution is apparently a chore, and was looked down upon. 

Angelhair pasta not offered here.

Al dente only, dont ask for anything else.

No parmesan offered with pasta

Beer selection limited, bummer.

Table service limited,  meh

Basically, i expect this level of selection and service from fast food, not a restaurant.  Very disappointing.

Asked for refund on entrees, received. 

Very disappointing

My family ate there on 4/19, we ordered egg plant stack app.  It was good but a bit unrefined, too thick slices of cheese and tomato.
For dinner chicken parm, no pasta...  Was deemed good. As well as pasta marinira.
My father and i both ordered the clams in white sauce, we couldn't eat more than 3 bites as it was way too salty and spicy from the chilis..  We sent both entrees back and didn't order anything else.   
Unfortunately we will not be ordering any pasta dishes from this resturaunt again...
Food was ok, host was  horrible and mediocre, slow very slow server even the place was empty, meatball salad is good as reviewed in this site.

I am very confused as to why this place doesn't have a 5 star rating. We went here for my best friend's wedding reception and fell in love with the amazing Italian food (some of the best I've ever had) and the fun atmosphere! My friend and I were singing along to all the songs. :) They really impressed me too when the chapel she got married in was running about an hour behind schedule and I called the restaurant to push back our reservation ON A FRIDAY NIGHT- they were so accommodating and understanding! The service was so great too. I wrote in the Open Table reservation notes that we were there for a small wedding reception and 2 of the staff came by and told the bride and groom congratulations! We will definitely be back next time we're in Vegas. Thank you so much, Martorano's for helping us make October 2nd such a memorable night.

I came here a few weeks ago for a some appetizers and a drink. The bread and chili oil was a really nice start with the Martini that I had. The meatball was flavorful and tender, I would definitely come here again to try one of the entrees.
Incredible Food, Service, Ambiance and Drinks!  Louis our server and the entire staff were fabulous!

Excellent staff and service. The food was outstanding and I really enjoyed the atmosphere. The eggplant Parmesan was large enough to share so you get your money's worth. A Notable wine list was also a nice compliment. This place is worth a try. Not to mention, for a more upscale place they were not pretentious and also were reasonably priced.
Awesome food and Sunday Gravy!!!  Meatballs are the bomb.... Yo Cuz!!! A must when in Vegas!

Went there this past week, stumbled upon a great Italian restaurant in Paris...who knew?  But the food was great!!!  We started by splitting the eggplant stack, highly recommend and I had the veal marsala, tender and delicious and my friend had the chicken parm which she said was great.  Super attentive waiter and manager checked in on us, great hospitality.  Check it out!
Wanted something to ease our hunger pains,  but now wanting a full meal.  Ordered the risotto at the bar and it was HEAVEN!  Melted in our mouths.  Looking forward to my next visit!
Excellent Italian. Had the Short Ribs and Pasta. Sounds wierd but was outstanding. We will definitely come back next time in LV.
Food was excellent. The service was the best I've ever had or seen. They really combine excellent together. Had Chris as our waiter. The food was outstanding

I ordered spaghetti with salad. The dressing was too sour and the meatball was salty. For our main entree, we ordered seafood spaghetti and a special item which both were super salty that we didn't finish. We drank so much water!
The music was too loud that we have to yell across the table to talk so we didn't say much. 
2 stars for the ambience of the restaurant. I will not be coming back!

Martarano salad was delicious. A bit pricy, but the food is pretty damned good. Ate at the bar, bartender was very attentive and the food came very fast. The linguine and clams was legit. Giant clam meat within the pasta. Delicious. Some might find it salty, but that dish is supposed to be. I would totally eat here again.

I've been ordering calamari as my favorite appetizer for decades and the Calamari Bisby is hands down without question the best I've ever eaten. It is the most tender bite of calamari you can imagine. The flavor profiles boasts a slightly spicy and sweet Kung poa style  taste leaving you wanting more.  Next time I come to Vegas I will be back for the appetizer alone. I ordered the veal Parmesan for an entree.  My companion ordered  the chicken parm. Both met and exceeded expectations, the chicken outweighing the the veal in tenderness and flavor. I will make an effort to return here next time I come to Las Vegas. The service was above par.  The waiter was helpful and the delivery/bussing service staff was borderline entertainment for the evening.  I can't stress enough to get the calamari Bisby even jf that is all you come for.

I went for dinner at 5pm, sat at the bar and ordered there signature dish, rigatoni with sunday gravy. I thought it was really good, but for $28 I expect a larger portion of pasta. Pasta is not expensive, so they should load all the plates up like many other Italian restaurants do. If so, I would have given a 4 star rating!

An unexpected find for amazing veal and chicken Marsala! Portions were great and the side of pasta and Caesar salad easily shareable. The atmosphere was fun but not overdone and our waitress amazing. She was so helpful with suggestions and attentive. The wine options also very good.
The absolute best Italian food anywhere!  We go to the one in Ft. Lauderdale often and the Vegas location is just as amazing! The meatballs, the Calamari Martorano, the Sunday sauce!  Just go!!!

I gave it two stars for the food. When we got seated, we got the iPad with the drinks. The waiter then gives us a spiel about the owner, food served family style, so if one dish is ready and the others are not, you must serve that dish and wait for the other dish to come out. If your other party doesn't want the dish you ordered, they sit and wait...and wait. They brought the appetizer, after yet another bus boy had brought the wrong dish, and we said we were splitting it. The assistant said he would be back to serve it to us. We waited   and waited while he went to get plates. Then waited some more. Finally he came with some plates.  THREE times the "assistants/bus boys" brought us the wrong meal to the table. They gave our food to the table next to us. They did let us keep one misplaced dish, but only after our waiter finally showed up and I told him we didn't order this. He said "yeah, the other table got your food" so we had to wait again for the food that we ordered. Since there was only two of us, the waiter was doting on the other table with four people. Bigger tip, I assumed. I ordered ice tea, and got a bottle of Chinese tea and a glass of ice. I guess they have various favors of bottled Chinese tea. Once the correct food finally arrived, it was ok. I've had better, but it was adequate. Will I go back? NO. No excuse for a restaurant that has been open for 6 months for the service. If this chef is so great, I suggest he hire a manager who knows how to staff a restaurant. The service was absolutely terrible and totally disorganized, and we were there on a night that it wasn't busy at all. I shudder to think what happens when that restaurant gets busy. My suggestion, go to Buddy V's at the Palazzo for good service and good food and walk past Martoranos at the Paris Hotel.
Jeremy, the bartender, was awesome. The food was awesome. We'll definitely come back. A great experience while watching the Cubbies win!!

I love Italian food and really wanted to enjoy this place but I didn't like it. The bread they brought was dry and tasteless. It came with olive oil or cheese or spicy olive oil and none of that helped it. Just gross.
For my main meal I got the veal piccata and risotto. There was two big pieces of veal and plentiful sauce but just not much flavor. And by the time I was halfway through the sauce was cold and it was congealed into a jelly like sticky glue. Risotto had zero flavor. It was supposed to have fresh veggies and cheese but veggies looked and tasted canned and it was just blah. 
I did have chocolate cake for dessert and it was very moist and good. I saved more than half for next day but unfortunately got very sick to my stomach about 30 minutes after this meal so I ended up throwing it away because I don't know what I ate here that did not agree with me. 
Service was fine.

STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS!  This place will not last long.  The servers act like frightened dogs.  The management is argumentative.  Your soda comes in a plastic bottle.  The music is so loud it could make a Slipknot fan complain about auditory pain after dining there.  The server tries to force you to order your entree at the same time as your appetizers and when confronted as to why you need to order our entree right away they smugly answer like mindless buffoons "Cuz that's the way we do it here".  By far the worse dining experience we have ever had in Vegas.  We didn't even get past the drinks before leaving that abortion of a restaurant. If you want a comparable dining experience for a lot less money, then do yourself a favor and go to the Double Down on Paradise and scrape the dried sputum off the floor and put it on a plate.  You won't even be able to tell the difference between that and  Martorano's complimentary bread with ground rat meat they place on the table prior to cattle prodding you into ordering.  I know it's an Italian restaurant so mind my French when I say this place SUCKS!

5 stars for service and food quality! Jessie was our server and she was outstanding. Super friendly, accommodating, and made us feel welcomed. All of her menu recommendations were spot on. For appetizers, we had the Famous Meatball and Eggplant Stacked. So delicious, I highly recommend both appetizers. Perfect sizes for sharing. For dinner we had the Veal Marsala and the Carbonara. So flavorful and authentic. Nice size portions as well. The atmosphere of the restaurant is really cool too. I'd definitely eat here again not only because the food is so good but the service we received was impeccable!

One has a circus of choice for dining in Vegas ... BUT why in the F*** would you not have a true dining experience.  The Chicken Parmesan is heaven wrapped in the most amazing gravy and fresh freakin' mozzarella.  Not to mention, Paul, our server  sat with us for a true  heart warming chat and laugh. My Silican Great Grandmother will disown me from the grave for this ... Love you Great Grandma Orlando ... The greatest Italian dining experience ever!  You must dine here!  

Why are you not here now!
We thoroughly enjoyed our meal at Martorano's. The food was excellent and the portions were very generous. The servers were friendly, professional, and attentive. We'll be back!

Restaurant was very nice although they play old gangster movies on several tvs throughout which makes it hard to pay full attention to the table... Service was top notch and food was delicious. Had the meatball to start and shared the rigatoni and the chicken parmigiana. The chicken was huge and tender but a bit too much cheese on top. Everything was going great until approx 9:15pm the music went from Sinatra style dinner music to blaring R&B and disco. It was quite strange and took away from the ambiance and the meal. The music was loud and awkward and with poor transitions. Great food and great service - just go before the 9pm discotheque starts!

Omg! This was my 1st visit and it did not disappoint even the bread was good. I the chicken parmesan and a side of fresh veggie risotto and I highly recommend both! I will totally be coming back next time I'm in Vegas. The atmosphere was energetic and it's a great place to people watch. The music is vibrant and therr were tv's with sports and movies on. The service was also superb.

Wow. Amazing meal. Read the reviews 1st and they were spot on! Do not miss the meatball and fried mozzarella appetizer and the egg plant app! We were getting full so we split the Rigatoni Sunday Pork and it was AMAZING!!!! Do not miss these 3 dishes. Our Bartender Evis recommended it and he was spot on. Had an wonderful glass of wine with it! We will be back every time we visit Vegas!

There is not too much to complain about here. Yes there are over priced items from on the menu. Stay away from them. The Carbonara Pasta dish is the BEST I ever had. And the meatball and Salad app was amazing. My Italian grandmother would be jealous of the Sunday "gravy" (We call it sauce).   Stay with the classics and you won't be disappointed.

Truly disappointing experience. From the blasé  greeting by the hostess to the rudeness and sloppiness of the bartender to the exorbitant prices for average food and drink, this was the low point of our week in Vegas. We really enjoy Italian and the quality here was unremarkable yet for top dollar. Mr Martorano has his picture prominently displayed throughout the restaurant. One would expect that he would take more personal pride in the delivery of quality and the hiring of professional staff.

Booked here because the experience in Florida was epic...food, service, atmosphere...well, this was the antithesis, as the restaurant was about 1/2 full (Tuesday eve) and the service was slow.  Food was not nearly as flavorful as I recall, and the portions were overly sauced.  Thumbs down.  Bummed I burned a Vegas meal, and in a gross hotel to boot.  I'll certainly give FL another shot.

Some food is good, some just ok. But the service is slow. Very slow. 35 minutes from being seated to getting our first drinks. This has happened on both occasions I've visited. The servers are friendly, at least. The atmosphere is also very Jersey Shore. If you're in to that, you might enjoy it more than I.

Holyyyyyy Shitballs. This place sucks. (Note: I start every review at 3 stars. You get three stars for existing. Good service? +1 star. Bad food? -1 star. Etc.)

Alright so: The food? Actually not that bad. Pretty decent meatballs, sauce that apparently is called "gravy." (Dear Steve Martorano: it's called sauce. Gravy is what you put on turkey on Thanksgiving. It's made from the juices and drippings of the bird. Look it up, cuz.)

So yeah, food was alright. That's as far as this review goes for positive feedback. Go to Martorano's if you enjoy the following:

- LED backlit menus
- an iPad drink menu that gets taken away as soon as you order your first drink (want to peruse the drink menu? Good luck tracking down your waiter to get it.)

- Disco lights that rotate over your table constantly, changing the color of your food from pink to yellow to green to bright white.

- the same 10 loud songs that totally don't fit the meal playing over and over again because apparently whoever is in charge of the music found a mix CD from 1997 in the trash outside of Bally's (Hope you like Doo Doo Brown and Jock Jams vol. 3 while you eat!).

- American Hustle playing on the TV's all around the place. Now listen, I'm into film, I'm a grown ass man, but I don't really appreciate watching permed-up Bradley Cooper mount Amy Adams while I dip my bread in olive oil, ya dig? But apparently they have also been known to play The Godfather pt. 2, which totally fits in with the music. NOT.

This place is what I'd expect from a guy with "Yo Cuz" tattooed on his arm. It's like a 14 year old kid tried DJing for 3 years, had no talent, stole his grandmother's sauce recipe (not gravy. SAUCE.), and opened a bunch of restaurants with shallow decor, a limited menu, and ZERO imagination. This is a perfect example of good food with piss poor execution. Slow it down, Steve, ditch all of the flashy crap, and dedicate the place to serving good food. Because the food isn't worth shit when the dining experience is akin to root canal. 

I'm looking forward to heading back next year, when this place is out of business and is replaced by a decent Italian restaurant, just like the one it replaced.

Final Verdict:
+1 Decent Food
-1 Music
-1 Lights, TV's, General Atmosphere
-1 Service (Wait staff is alright. But ordering from an ipad that you share with other tables? Not so much. Oh and be sure to fill out the survey on the ipod touch when you get the bill! It's SO hip!)

I won't say avoid at all costs - but get the food to go. Do not eat in the dining room.

Simply stated, everyone should be aware that this establishment refuses to accommodate any food allergies or food related diseases. 

While I have a number of food allergies, I am definitely not one of those individuals who asks for outrageous customizations to the menu in order to be accommodated and I have never had to walk out of a restaurant due to a refusal to be served - not even in France, where I had to ask (in English!) to have my meal prepared without butter. So, imagine my surprise when I sat down with my extended family, for a birthday dinner for my aunt, and the waiter flat out refused to serve me one of the salads on the menu without dressing and a side of olive oil and vinegar. I did not ask for a dish to be prepared differently, only to not have salad dressing. I explained to the waiter it was a severe allergy and that I would only be ordering wine and the salad and he was so rude and obnoxious in his refusal that he reduced me to tears in front of 8 family members. 

Needless to say, my fiancé and I left the restaurant and my aunt's celebration and will never return to this establishment. From what I understand from those that stayed, the salads were all prepared with far too much dressing, their version of "al dente" pasta is literally a workout to chew and is really nothing more than under-cooked and the service and attitude of the staff never improved. With so many options available in Las Vegas and even just within the Paris, I would be surprised to see this place still in business when I next return.
Came here for a bachelorette party dinner and it was so yummy. Perfect portions and the menus lit up. So cool!

Where do I begin with this review. Wow is the first word that comes to mind! My family and I had a 8pm reservation. As soon as I gave our name we were seated immediately. The ambiance of this restaurant is FIRST CLASS! The decor, the service, the music, the menus that light up, everything is NEXT LEVEL. We had a wonderful server who came over and seated us immediately. We started off with the Famous Meatball & Salad and Fried Calamari Martorano. One word: AMAZING!!!! The meat ball had SO MUCH flavor. It was very tender and rich but not overcooked at all. It spread apart with a slight push of the fork. The gravy, very flavorful and rich. The salad was fresh and very flavorful as well. The Calamari....seasoned and cooked to PERFECTION along with the sauce and green peppers, hands down the best calamari I've ever eaten, PERIOD! I had actually stopped eating calamari the past 8-10 years because it simply wasn't prepared right the past few times I had eaten it(restaurants should take notes from Steve). These were our appetizers. 
Next up, entrees! The kids kept it very basic, spaghetti with sauce(no gravy, sauce) and salad. My wife ordered Linguine in White Clam Sauce and I ordered the Philly Cheesesteak. I didn't try any of my wife's but she said it was fabulous. I was nervous about the cheesesteak because I don't like a lot of bread, especially if it's hard and firm. My plate came out and the sandwich was PIPING hot. So hot I had to allow it to cool down. I finally took my first bite and the flavors oozed inside of my mouth. The cheese, the steak(SO tender and juicy) and the bread roll was not too big and it was beyond soft. The meat and cheese seemed like it sank into the inside of the bread and it made a perfect fit! The peppers on the side were spicy(exactly like I like them), juicy and fresh! I only ate half of the sandwich and I was stuffed! The kids finished their meal off with cake that I didn't try ONLY because I was too full. Steve and Marsha treated us like family! Steve is one of the most humble, authentic people I have ever met in my life. What you pay for when dining at Cafe Martorano is a EXPERIENCE, period! Its truly entertainment: the music, the movies on the big screens, the decor, the service, the food; it's simply on another level. When we visit Vegas again in a couple of months I know exactly what I'm ordering and I can't wait! Hands down the best Italian food in Vegas, no questions asked! 
Yo Cuz!!!!!

I read some of the other reviews and I cannot speak on the ambiance in the main dining room as we sat out in the patio area. I will however speak on the food.

I took a client here for dinner on a Thursday night before a night out. We ordered a bottle of wine and the calamari to start. The service was excellent, the wine was presented well, and the calamari was out of this world (I'm a bit of a calamari snob). I then ordered the Chicken Sicilian. I'll make this short...this is probably the best Italian food I have ever had and I used to manage an Italian restaurant. My client was also very satisfied as we were talking about how good dinner was for the rest of the night.

Again, I didn't experience the atmosphere of the main dining room which, from reading other reviews I could see as being kind of cheesy. But if you are just looking for great food, go here and sit out in the "patio" area, which is in front of the restaurant out in the main hallways of the Paris Casino.

I don't know why this restaurant doesn't have 5 stars. Our experience was incredible. The food was to die for, their homemade mozzarella was out of this world. Very authentic food, and we know because we are Italian! Highly recommend!

So we ate again here two days later and AGAIN, the food was phenomenal. Chris our server was outstanding and Jeff the manager was great as well. After talking to them and picking their brain about who Steve Martorano was, we now love it even more. Our kind of restaurant and our kind of guy! 

Don't hesitate to eat here. Incredible place.

Give it 4 stars for the food I had, 4 stars for service, 3 stars for price (I understand location costs) and 3 stars on seating (explain below.)

First of all if you are staying or gambling at Paris or Bally's, good Italian, real good. Can I get better in Utica, NY or Philly or Brooklyn or Jersey or....mom's kitchen, yeah, yeah, maybe, but you are in Vegas. If you like veal, you gotta try the house Veal Cutlet Martorano. It is spicy with peppers and really sharp tasty cheese. I get veal all over and am a pretty good cook myself, I'm gonna figure this recipe out (steal it)!  I had it with the sauteed greens (spinach) crisp, fresh & tasty. Why not escarole? I was drinking bourbon, so the food review ends there.

Now if you want a little privacy, stay off the rail with all the casino pedestrian traffic. Interior is ok. I don't get the movies or music, give me Italian music, Martorano!

Wait & bus were attentive and personable. I don't get the lit up menus, but then again I'm old fashioned.

My food was 4 star, I'd give the place 3.5 overall, and yeah I'll be back for the veal & greens.
Excellent service, food and ambience. Highly recommend this restaurant, they aim to please.

Just Amazing...There is nothing else to say!  Our server Paul was very knowledgeable and offered several suggestions on what to try.  Food was just like Mom makes...Home cooking and fantastic flavor. 
You MUST come and try the rice balls and meat balls!!  WOW!

A relatively new restaurant in between Bally's and Paris, which replaced another Italian restaurant. I will say this place is much better than the previous restaurant, but that's about it.
The decor is very nice, modern with a classic touch, very inviting. It's a restaurant slash sort of night club with a DJ slash bar. When we were in there happened to be a Jazzercise convention in town and all of a sudden 30 women from outside and inside the restaurant went to the dance floor and danced their shoes off. It was a nice touch to the evening. 
5 of us sat at the bar, which ended up be very nice, since we got a corner. 
I will say the whole Yo Cuz thing and life size posters of Steve and him on TV over the bar in a loop cooking just doesn't cut it for me. It was almost a turn off. Seeing a tattooed jacked guy in a tight shirt and cooking with no audio over and over got old very fast. I would rather see a logo spinning or a game on TV. 
To start with the menus illuminate! Very classy touch. How many times is it too dark and you can't read the menu, this is the first time seeing anything like this. Their main menu opens up and it has a easy on the eyes white glow. In addition they have an iPad for drink specials AND food specials. We weren't told about this until after we ordered appetizers as it wasn't clear that there was more to the iPad menu. For drinks I had an amazingly smooth vodka martini, highly recommend it. 
For appetizers we shared the meatball salad, the eggplant stack and the fried calamari martorano. The meatball salad is a great idea, haven't seen that too much however you need to have a good meatball. Not the worst meatball but frankly it was not good. Way too dry and I believe too much pork. They say it was voted one of the best meatballs around, they probably didn't have real Italians try them. Do not get it, you will be disappointed. 
The eggplant stack was good, nice crust on the eggplant again nothing special. Now the Calamari Martorano, that's no normal fried calamari, and this time I mean that it a good way. The sweet and spicy pepper tomato sauce with balsamic vinegar was delicious. The calamari were tender and the plate was full of flavor. For an extra spice drizzle the spicy oil they bring it with the bread! One thing I don't understand is they have a second fried calamari dish, why have two? I would rather see a different dish. 
For the main dish I ordered off the specials (see the iPad). I had the double cut pork chop in a vinegar pepper sauce. The pork was cooked through and through, but more importantly the meat was very moist and full of flavor. It's tough to cook pork all the way and keep it moist and tender, these guys know how. In addition it was a very large portion, as we noticed on a lot of there dishes. 
Have to give credit to the bar back, not only did she clean up and help the bartenders, she served our appetizers family-style and was on top of anything we needed. Made the experience at the bar feel like we had a waitress, nice job. 
You get a lot for the money, big portions and big flavor at Martorano's!

If you're at Paris and looking for a great restaurant then eat at Martoranos. Excellent service and food is delicious. Big portions which is nice. Our server Jessie was super cool. Great personality and very attentive to our needs. She recommended the eggplant stack... wow!! And the famous meatball is amazing!! Must order this! We had the veal Marsala and penne alla vodka. Food is awesome I'll definitely be back! Great job Martorano you have great food and great employees! Thank you to our server Jessie she was awesome.

First off, the service was good and the appetizers were decent.  We had the mozzarella (good) and the rice balls.  Before I continue I just want to share my qualifications for even giving a review - I can cook a wide array of foods; from Peking duck, to rib roast with béarnaise, to what has been said is lasagna as good as anything that can be found in northern Italy (with homemade sauce).  
My wife had penne ala vodka, and while the flavor was good, the plated portion was at most worth $18-20, even by Las Vegas Strip standards, not the $28 they were asking for.  I had the Veal ala Martorano.  The "sauce" was basically some stewed tomatoes, chunks of garlic and chunks of Chile peppers (Serrano's), some salt and pepper over fried veal.   Now for those of you who enjoy heat for the sake of heat then you might very well enjoy the "sauce".  However, I find that spices-heat should not appear out of nowhere like a left jab to the face, depending on which fork full of food you happen to take a bite of.  They should be infused in the dish and add to the flavor, not fight with the other flavors.  That was not the case with this dish.  If you think you might like the dish then I would suggest trying it this way -go buy a Serrano chile and get a slice of pizza.  Then take a bite of each at the same time.  This will save you the $32 cost of trying the "veal ala martorano" to see if you like it, although it may be an insult to your favorite pizza.

We were at Paris Hotel for 4 nights in February 2017. We enjoyed a lot of good food but by far this was our best overall experience. From the reservationist the day before to the hostess the water server all the way thru to our waiter it was primo. Food was excellent as well, we shared the waiter's recommended special of the night - be sure to check the iPad for their specials. Loved sitting out on The Avenue as well. If we are back at Paris Hotel, we will definitely return.

I wanted to dislike this place.  The life-sized wall posters of the giant tattooed Italian American Cook with his catchphrase "Yo, Cuz" along with omnipresent clips of HIS favorite movies and HIS favorite cooking show (himself) should be all the warning you need that you are dealing with a massive ego here.  Oh, if that weren't enough, the entrance to Paris on the Arc has one giant image of Gordon Ramsay and one of this guy.  So, at first glance, I'm thinking, "Ego, pure and simple, and nothing more."

I'm happy to say I was impressed by the outcome, though.  Ego or not, this food is good.  Now, disclosure, I'm not Italian, so I'm probably not as harsh a critic as others.  But, I've eaten at a fair share of Italian places, and I know some authentic Brooklynites of Sicilian heritage who know a thing or two about cooking.

This place nails it.  The fried mozz, best I've ever had.  A giant ball of fresh, in-house made mozzarella, thick sauce with spicy peppers, perfectly cooked and seasoned.  The bolognese (special of the day while we were there) was literally the best I'd ever had.  I mean, just melt-in-your-mouth amazing.  Cocktails were great, no complaints here either.  

I'd definitely come back here again if I'm ever in Vegas and craving good Italian.  This was well worth the visit.  For Vegas, the prices were actually pretty decent, too.  

It does get a bit loud there, though, especially after 9pm.  They warn you about this, but it's still hard to hold a decent conversation, even with someone right next to you.  Part of the kitsch, I guess.

This place was one of my favorites. The had Emlo as their house wine, which is always a plus. The food was great. I went with a nice Caesar salad and a fish dish. Everything at this place was perfect. 

The menus were electronic and very neat. We sat on the patio which is not really outside, but the hotel area had painted ceilings so it seems like you were somewhere else. 

Food was top notch! Highly recommend.

Not satisfied with this restaurant at all. I went around early afternoon and the restaurant was pretty slow, only a handful of people. You would think we wouldn't have to wait. That was not the case. We had to wait over a half an hour for the waiter to take our order. And almost another half hour for the food to come! It would have been worth it if the food was 5 stars but it was completely average, and for what I am paying (overpriced for the quality) and waiting for, I expected more. Disappointed with the service and the food here and will definitely not be going back.

My boyfriend and I went there a couple of weeks ago during our stay in Vegas. 
I have nothing but great things to say about this place! 
First off, WOW on the food!!!
It was one of the best meals we've ever had! All the food was delicious. 
Beautiful restaurant and cool technology - love the lit up menus and tablets to order dessert and such off of. 
We ate at the bar to watch the NBA playoff game and Jeremy took great care of us. 
It was an all-around wonderful experience! 
If you're in Vegas, eat here

Very loud inside. All entrees served have no sides and they don't allow any substitutions or anything to their menu. Server was friendly. Managers are very cold, unhappy and look like they hate hate their lives. Ordered the veal marsala and it was ok. Got an $18 side order of spinach, lol. I'll never go back or recommend this place to other locals or tourists. There are better options folks!
Food is pretty good.  Service is so so so slow.... almost feel like you have been held hostage by hostess.  Price is reasonable. Portions are actually too big.

Service was terrible, we sat at the bar but were basically ignored, we left after an appetizer and two drinks, really annoying, food is good but give me a break, too many options for great Italian in Vegas to put up with that

This is a very nice hang, catering to a very middle-America crowd.

Points for lovely design, friendly service, and Strip-central location. 

Review based on bar service only.

I had a very nice time at the Martorano's bar last night.
Very friendly, knowledgable service. Nice lighting and not too Crowded (Wednesday evening after ten). 

I had a house-specialty cocktail called "Angel" -an upscale twist on a margarita. Sweet, but I knew that going into it. Followed by a glass of Pinot -Grigio. 

And here's the thing: I was so distracted by the wine glasses, that I almost forgot about the beverage. Rarely have I heard a wine glass ring so beautifully. It was like an alcoholic Tibetan singing bowl. Truly marvelous. 

But the wine: eh..the selection was pretty average -same with beers and whiskys.  The house cocktails are pretty standard for the Strip - as were the prices. Three beverages came to $42 +tip.

And here's the other thing: I love Italian food, and spent many years in Boston's North End - the traditionally Italian part of town. Even the best pasta dish is inexpensive to make, and should not be flamboyant. Simple good food made from fresh ingredient is what it is all about. 

Martorano's is "production Italian". More emphasis on presentation than is necessary for such a simple cuisine - with prices to match. The gullible are easy to impress. But again, pretty normal for The Strip.
I'll go back for the hang, and the singing wine glasses. Probably go light  on the food.

First time and it was very presentable. Had reservations in advance. Waited about 15 minutes because we were early. The menu is right in front and you can scroll through it to see what goodies you would like to eat. When you get seated they have an electronic presentation the waiter does with wine etc... They bring out the fresh baked house bread and several dips for it. We had the big Meatball, which was excellent. Ordered Linguine & the fried Lobster tail. The risotto was the best so far I have eaten. The experience was the BEST! I will be back for more of that. Dessert & everything was the ALL Delicious!! The flat screen tvs were all over, no sound. I heard there is a DJ on the weekend and the floor turns in to dancing which was not the night we were there. It was a good experience. Lots of food that it is ridiculous. But we ordered a lot of food!! I wish they had sample platters for sale!! Guess I will have to eat here again to try the other dishes. Very upscale in price so please see the menu. Ambiance, presentation, food display, employees on top of their game were all Excellent!!

Great food and awesome atmosphere. I had the chicken with peppers and mushrooms and it was great. The bartender picked a great wine to go with it. I loved the fact the Gm Jeff came by to introduce himself. Definitely will come back next time I'm in LV. (It also doesn't hurt when you're favorite movie is playing in the background, Casino!)

Now aside from homemade spaghetti and meat balls at home and a pizza from our favorite pizza parlor,  I'm not much for Italian cuisine. That being said, while staying at the hotel my wife and I decided to give Martorano's a try as an alternative to our usual steak house, seafood, and buffet dining. We had a bad experience, first they gave us probably the worst table in the house, right at the restaurant entrance so parties waiting for their table were standing right over our table. Ok we didn't let that bother us to much. Now the food. My wife ordered the Linguine in white clam sauce, what she got was Linguine soaking in olive oil that taste a little rancid. Neither of us could eat the Linguine but she did eat the clams they were ok..  I ordered the Rigatoni with Sunday gravy recommended by the server. A big chunk of roast pork that was fairly tasty but there was not enough gravy to satisfy my taste so I asked for a little more gravy, the server said he could do that for a  5 dollar cup of gravy as a side dish. ( WHAT ) I did not pay the 5 dollars simply out of principal. I could not finish my plate.   I'm not someone that makes a big deal about bad food or service ( service was ok ) in a restaurant because it makes for an uncomfortable situation for all. I just do not return.(  later that night I picked up a couple slices of pizza at JJ Boulangerie )

That's right...five stars. ..I have had a lot of carbonara Pasta in my life.   This was truly amazing.  They actually stir the egg in at the table.   The pizza my husband had was thin crust and delightful!

Im giving this restaurant 2 stars only for the food....  the loud atmosphere and the I could care less attitude from the waiter Paul because the owner wants it that way doesn't work for me.   If a customer requests COOKED  pasta and  NOT al dente pasta.... it should be cooked as requested.... it's the same as when someone requests a steak to be cooked  certain way it gets done.... pasta should be no different.    I as a paying customer don't care how the owner thinks it should be cooked.    As a local to Vegas I have to say I will be thinking twice before returning to this restaurant in the future.   Also sound is too loud.... TVs were way too loud.... We couldn't even hear the specials, neither could the waiter hear our order. Again was told the owner likes it that way.    I don't think as a family we should be shouting across the table so we can hear each other.

After scrolling through yelp reviews, this place sure seems hit or miss, but after getting a raving review from a friend we decided to take the gamble. Let me tell you, it sure paid off. I'm still drooling over my dinner last night. 

Let me begin by saying the this restaurant has a modern, club like feel. Blue lights, disco balls, sleek bar....and REALLY loud music (I could have done without the last part. The music was so loud I could not hear own waiter and make it difficult to sustain conversation. On the upside, they were playing my jams so I spent most of the time lip singing in my seat as I waiting for my food). 

They provided us with a small complimentary portion of pate on toasted sliced bread. I couldn't hear the waiter, so I can't tell you what is was exactly...whatever it was, it was delicious. Complimentary bread was left on the table with olive oil, cheese and some kind of oil based chili sauce for dipping. I live a gluten free life style and unfortunately they do not offer gluten free bread. (They do however offer gluten free pasta.)

As for my meal, I started with an EXTRA dirty martini which was on point. Props to the bartender. For dinner I ordered the pork chop which was one of the chef specials for the evening. I highly recommend, it was HUGE, perfectly seared and seasoned sitting upon a bed of cooked greens with the most delicious peppers which added the perfect amount of a kick. 

I definitely recommend this place, I left stuffed and oh so satisfied.

Seven Stars guest--arrived 10 minutes early--told us we had to wait because the waiter was not available (since when is that the customer's fault?) --asked for another open table--was told the waiter at that table was waiting for a party of 10 and couldn't seat us until that group arrived..wow---decided to wait for the first waiter to become available -even though there were many open tables-finally were seated--waited 15 minutes--no water, no bread, no excuse me I'll be with you in a minute--no nothing---told my fiancé that if no one came our table within one more minute we were going to leave-and we did-went to Mon Ami Gabi--and loved it

Got a recommendation from a friend to come here for their al dente pasta and great calamari appetizer.

Went with my boyfriend and took my younger brother here too.

The service is great, beautiful restaurant.

The menu even lights up with the open it which really helps since it is a low lit place.

When the food comes out, it is served to you, which is nice, but I like to take pictures of it before it is served, so it kinda messed up their flow.  I felt bad, but I needed pictures....to post on yelp of course! :)

The server was nice, but he pushed too hard on a good review.  He saw I was looking at yelp and asked if i was going to do a review.  i said yes, and he asked if he was going to get 5 stars.  To be polite, I said yes.  The push of a good review was a turn off.

The food was just okay....not much flavor and not good textures.

I had dinner at the bar last night. I had chicken Sicilian and it was delicious. In my view, it was a large serving. I did noticed that the couple next to me ordered appetizers,  the appetizers seemed exquisite. It is pricey, but the quality of the food is well worth it. Exceptional service from everybody.
The food was excellent and the servers were great. Ray and Francisco were our servers and they were so attentive and prompt with everything. We really enjoyed it and we will be back!

Classic American Italian made to perfection. It seems like it all starts with the ingredients here; the house made mozzarella and ricotta were delicious. You can absolutely taste the difference in these dishes compared to any other Italian food you're used to. We started with the shrimp scampi appetizer that out server plated for the two of us to split. The scampi sauce was awesome. I got the bucatini and meatballs and enjoyed every aspect of the dish. The "gravy" was simple and delicious, perfect al dents pasta, extremely flavorful meatball, and the final perfect element: that dollop of ricotta.

Aside from the food, the service and atmosphere were also worth the 5 stars! Our server was super attentive, excited to tell us about the food, answer any questions and made a great wine recommendation. (It was their brand that they sell at the restaurants and online which we'll be ordering very soon!). We loved the fun super club atmosphere and you go in looking forward to enjoying this unique fun experience.

My only tip for them would be to make sure the hours are advertised consistently. I went to check out some other yelp reviews while we were dining and noticed it said the location was closed. Spread the word that it's open late & has awesome late night full dinner service!

Will recommend to friends that visit Vegas and return to this spot when I'm back!

Our server Bryce and Edgar did amazing job tonight as a host. We were not planning to visit here for our dinner but we were extremely pleasantly surprised. I would really recommend here for dinner their lobster with lemon sauce was great.

I can't remember the last time I had Italian food this good! The meatball salad and the eggplant stack are the best appetizers on the menu and are great for sharing. They  advertise having the best chicken parmigiana in Las Vegas and I think they are right! The lasagna was also great. Mark, our server did an outstanding job and made the night that much better. Unfortunately, we never made it to desert, we were way to full. I will definitely return on my next visit.
Our severs Raymond and Francisco were excellent and so was our food. Chicken Downtown was fantastic.

My husband and I were told to have Italian here.. we were on miracle mile.. rt outside the mall a short walk in flats of course to Paris straight through the the cobble stone walkway 
Didn't need to wait to be seated at 8:30 hostess gave us out on perimeter dining 
Service was not over top but pretty good 
Bread was somewhat ignored 
Water was on spot!
Drinks, order, food, presentation were all very good.
Willing to fetch anything we needed didn't anticipate my needs..but still adequate. Linen, nice glass wear and flatware.
Our food which I don't recall with all the talking and drinking and more drinking was pretty damn tasty 
It was good.
Experience given was very nice 
Bill was what was expected $$$
Overall I'd do again

Stopped in to have a cocktail for the first time. Sat at the bar as I am apt to do and was glad that I did. Nathan, the bartender, was a true professional. My martini was made just to my liking. I ordered the special, Bolenese. It was fresh and delicious. I requested a glass of wine and Nathan's recommendation was spot on. I will definitely be back again.

If you e ever been to the restaurant in Florida, then don't go here. Will totally be disappointed! 
My husband and I started w the meatball n salad app. Which was made for one!! Super small, not enough to share! Sauce was great! Meatball? Eh.. The theme of the restaurant seemed a bit watered down, especially w the wait staff wearing "yo cuz" shirts. One word of advice, "yo Steve, do us real fans of yours a favor. Get your ASS to VEGAS  and tell those Fu-ers at Cesears To let you do your thing.

First time at this restaraunt. Great service and great food. Must try meatball salad. Portions very large and can be shared.
Little pricey but worth it.

Cant modify the dishes what so ever, maybe i don't know Italian food but i wouldn't eat here again. I asked for a salad and asked if i could have the dressing on the side cus i hate heavy dressing on my salads.. I was told no that they couldnt modify anything. Came with a crowd of five people hungry and left hungry. No one finished their plate of food and the bill was 300$ There are so many places to eat, dont think its necessary to even try... Staff is friendly but thats about it.

Great place. Great food! Calamari Martorano special is excellent for appetizer. You must have an appetizer before your main course because great food must be prepared from scratch, so waiting is a must. If you are in a hurry I do suggest eating at McDonald's. Please no substitute in the chefs dishes, let it be. Everything is prepared old school traditional family recipes.

We ate at the bar because we didn't call ahead for reservations.  I'm glad we did.  Jeremy, our server, was great.  Made good recommendations, had jokes all night and made it a pleasant experience. By way of food, I started with calamari and then had a seafood pasta special.  I thought all of the food was phenomenal.
Yo Cuz!! Because you have to!! Four days in LV eating in the "well known chef's hubs" and THIS place rocked it!!!
Great place to celebrate a birthday! Food was wonderful, service was excellent. I will definitely be coming back!

I was in Vegas this past weekend and had dinner at Martorano's Paris and it was ABSOLUTELY GREAT!!!
I had the most delicious sea bass that melted in your mouth in the most wonderful white wine sauce, I mean gravy. 
Steve was around and I the pleasure to meet him, he is a super nice guy, down to earth I thought that was so refreshing.
I LOVED this place and would go again every time I'm in Vegas!

Great service, go between 4:30-8p the music isn't blaring so you can have a nice meal. Beware the waiters are great sales people so keep that in mind when asking for suggestions from them. Hands down the BEST MEATBALLS ever. Penne in Vodka sauce was a bit dry but the chicken parm was everything ! Overall delicious food, pricey but that is what is to be expected from a strip restaurant.
Very authentic Italian food.   You cannot change anything on the menu  which was a bit annoying but understandable once the food came out.   The pasta was al Dente and so delicious.

Review for dinner, 9:30 pm Saturday 12/12. Reservation made through Open Table. I can't stress enough how wonderful an experience we had at Martorano's this evening. Server Paul went absolutely above and beyond our expectations. My wife and I chose to share an app, entree, and two sides. Paul did us the favor of splitting our order tableside and even served us for an extra personal touch. He couldn't have been more personable, attentive, helpful, and funny. 

The food we orders was incredible. The fresh mozzarella and cherry tomatoes with evoo, sea salt, and a 25yr balsamic reduction came out first, and let me tell you, coming from someone who use to sell fine cheese, this mozz was top notch. The 16oz NY Strip was a perfect medium rare, and the blistered shishito peppers were the perfect compliment. The sautéed greens were cooked perfectly as well, and the risotto may be one of the best I've had. 

Note to potential diners, on Friday and Saturday they have a DJ performing in house. Great mix, but can be loud in the main dining hall if that's not your thing. 

Bonus points for Rocky playing on the tv's in the dining room :-)

Food was excellent. Had the Spaghetti Pescatore.

Music was horrible.  LOUD disco music in an Italian restaurant?!? Strobe lights?!?

Will not go back unless the music changes or better yet goes away completely.

Ok in June my wife and I went there and after waiting almost 45 minutes for our dinner we left because the service sucked. 

We when back this trip in sept and unfortunately had the dinner. Horrible and over priced. 

The pasta dishes we over salted and just bad. We asked if we could have one of the dishes without hot pepper and were told NO, the chef and owner refuses to accommodate. Well this chef can go F himself. I'll never go back and I would tell everyone else much better places to go in Vega.

Ate here last night...

NOT IMPRESSED

Food was mediocre, nothing to write home about.  Found that for Italian food, price was a bit high. And the entree I ordered was not served with a pasta.

I love the meatballs but hate the dining atmosphere here.  It's loud with music and movies etc.  Just a different vibe and not for me so I always order food to-go.

Meatballs 5/5
The meatballs are about as big as a tennis ball and super delicious!!

The best meatballs on the planet. Period. The meatball with salad option also comes with ricotta cheese and bread... might just be the best meal you will ever eat. I don't care how loud the movie playing is, I don't care how loud the music is... When I am eating this meal, nothing else matters. I'm in heaven.

I have told friends about this and they say " I don't even like meatballs and if I did, I would want them with spaghetti"

I just order for them and when it gets to the table and they start eating it.... They convert right away. So even if having a meatball with a salad sounds terrible to you... Try it. You will love it.

Just a note... If not all then 99% of the 1 star reviews are from jack-off people that are upset the restaurant won't make changes to dishes to make them happy. Go to Olive Garden people ... They will do anything to accommodate you. More pepper, less salt, more sauce, no sauce, this on the side, blah blah blah. This place makes it CRYSTAL CLEAR that they will make NO CHANGES TO ANYTHING. PERIOD. I love that. Finally a place that doesn't fold to these idiots that want to have everything adjusted to them. If you want something made a certain way.. Make it at home. If you don't like MARTORANO'S policy.. AWESOME! Don't go.
OMG! Best food I've had in a long time and I have family in the restaurant business! Please open up in the Los Angeles area!

I've been to this location three times and the old one a couple. I've never had a problem with the quality of the food, it's amazing. If the place is at capacity, the service might be a little slow but that's to be expected. Some of these reviews are from some spoiled ass people that don't know anything about the biz. I'm sorry they don't customize dishes but it states it clearly on the menu! No one put a gun to your head and said eat. Maybe in old Vegas they would have. Then again they would have done us all the favor and buried your fake foodie asses in the desert afterwards.

My husband and I were pleasantly surprised by just how fresh and good the food was. We normally go outside of whatever hotel we staying in but very glad we checked this place out for dinner before our show.  
The portions are quite generous, enough to share. My husband had already eaten a heavy snack just an hour before our arrival.  Even though I'm an eater, I really needed his help with the Parmesan chicken, mozzarella & tomatoes and sautéed spinach.
Our server Luis was excellent. Will definitely return here for dinner next time we're in Vegas.

We ate here while showing a friend around the Paris Hotel and we thought we'd be in for some incredible food after hearing all the waiter had to tell us. We were prepared to be blown away by amazing food. It it fell short. I like my pasta al dente but this was just too undercooked almost to the point of being crunchy. The sauce was just ok and so was the meatball. The ricotta was really good. The guys that ordered the veal and chicken parm didn't have any gripes but weren't blown away either. I think if you set people up for greatness as the staff does, then you should deliver. That didn't happen. The mozzarella appetizer was good but not over the top delicious as promised. It was just eh....  I come from a long line of great Italian cooks, especially my Dad, and this stuff just can't touch any of their stuff.

Nice location and atmosphere,  but that's it!!
The server we had was unhelpful and messed up the bill three times and still didn't get it righ.
A couple of us had the salad and couldn't eat it as it was all vinegar,  them came the worse pasta clam dish ever.
Also the pricing is outrageous...this was not a good experience

Over hyped, over priced, lousy service and UNDERCOOKED chicken Parmesan - we stopped in here after a show and were very disappointed 

The topper was RAW chicken served - saw the previous post on the veal and agree - average cut over breaded and just a glob of sauce plopped on top

Diner Beware !!!

Never have had a bad experience dining here - if you're looking for a nice Italian dining option on the Las Vegas Strip - consider Martorano's! On this visit we sat at the bar and had the terrific Nate for our server - we started off with the meatball & salad (even to share between 2 people) - you get chef's famous big meatball and nicely seasoned Italian salad, for main course we had one of the evenings specials - the You Cuz Linguini with fresh shellfish and one of our regular favorites the Penne al Vodka. We finished off with a slice of decadent cheesecake. The entrees are served family style so definitely suitable for sharing - there's not too many side offerings but I've had the sautéed greens before. They have daily specials so be sure to check on in the Ipad. Entrees range from about $28 - $50 for most. Convenient location at the Paris and since the one at the Rio has been closed - this is the spot! They are only open for dinner. Don't miss out - check it out and you'll leave happy and full! ;-)
Incredible menu, fabulous service, and a Sunday Gravy worth a second helping. We'll be back for sure.

Delicious!

Service is great to start.

I had the rigatoni with Sunday gravy and it was just right. Perfectly cooked. There s a small side of ricotta cheese you mix in to give it a bit more of luxury.

Great food. Meatball was great and succulent. Our server Mike was gregarious as they are. Fully explained the menu, the options and his delivery was personable.  Even his help Jamie was great help, helped serve our food and was attentive,  kudos to both.  Great ambience and good dacor. Only downfall was limited selection on pasta options and hostess weren't the most personable.

This italian restaurant is located inside Paris hotel and casino. We came here for dinner one Thursday evening. We did not have a reservation but got a table without waiting. We were given a table near the bar and entrance which was busy. We tried the highly rated chicken parmigiana and spaghetti. We were pretty satisfied with the service and food. The place is located across the hotel buffet. The prices are higher compared to similar restaurants.

Very limited lunch menu, food overall was good, not the best Italian Ive had but not the worst either. When we asked for bread our waitress said they only serve bread during lunch hours..hm, ok. Im giving them only 3 stars because the experience was boring, we were the only guests at the restaurant. Probably wont go back..

I came to Martorano's with a request: seating for a party of 25, within 30 minutes. After a few escalations, we haggled it for 45 minutes, and only if my party agreed to do things "family style" - that is, order a bunch of stuff from the menu, and everyone shares. No problem! This was a great compromise, and I was so grateful they let us do this. Awesome service, both in that regard and once we were all seated. All of our servers were attentive, kept the wine flowing, and were able to talk in an educated way about the food that was being served to us.

There were a couple of pain points though. First, while they wanted us to do family style, they didn't have a policy in place for it. We actually just had to order 3-5 of each menu item, and pay the same price. Not quite what we expected (the manager led me to believe there was a specific family style menu). Second, the food is just fine, but some of it just isn't worth the cost. $30+ spaghetti? It's good, but not quite that good. No one at all in our party liked the 
Linguine in White Clam Sauce.

I'd recommend the veal, meatballs, and calamari bibzy. And making a reservation for large parties ;)

Hands down the best meal I've had in Vegas in my life. I not only love this place but I've been here 8 times. Everything was perfect. Literally. From the amazing food to the amazing service to the amazing bar to the amazing prices to the amazing location. I can't say enough about this meal! One love cuz, one love.

Our server Paul is the man. He took the restaurant experience to the next level. When you get details about the history, about the mozzarella being made fresh daily, the can't miss meatballs, and his favorites...you are set up for success. 

The caprese salad is bomb. Fresh mozzarella, tomato, crispy basil and aged balsamic. Yes. Get it. That was probably my favorite. 

The meatball is 1 big meatball with a side of a tasty salad. Paul split the meatball for us and some salad, awaited our joy, and we let him know he was right - it's tasty. I wouldn't say the hype is THAT accurate, but it is a nice app. The salad it comes with is a little higher on vinegar which is a nice cut to the meatiness of the dish. 

We also split the spaghetti pescatore - aka seafood spaghetti in a tomato sauce. The pasta here is cooked al dente (firm) and this is how I'm used to eating pasta so I was super happy about it. If you're used to a more cooked pasta, don't be shocked. 

It was too much food. We were both like a package of crescent rolls - a second away from popping. If you're sharing, I'd recommend 1 app and 1 entree. Or 3 apps. 

It's vegas, so somehow this wasn't weird, but they have a dj and disco ball scenario going on in the restaurant. It threw me off because the food quality and service is more upscale, and then you have club music in the background. It didn't detract for us just a talking point. Another, don't be surprised, thing. 

I know I already preached about Paul, but I can't say enough good things about him. He's full of fun facts, is super likeable, and at the end you want to invite him to join your table. 

Good food, great service, dinner for two around $120 (2 apps, 1 entree, 2 glasses of wine).

Ohhhhh man, I don't even know where to start with this delicious experience! My best friend and her family make it a tradition to come to Martorano's every time they are in Vegas and this time, I was the lucky guest that got to learn WHY they love this place so much! I'm not sure why they only have 3.5 stars because I thought it was absolutely incredible from beginning to end and left the most full that i've ever been. HIGHLIGHT: The menus LIGHT UP so that you can see what you're reading! I've never seen this before and it is such a cool concept! :) 

We ordered a delicious bottle of Malbec to start, and enjoyed it along with their family-style apps {that they dish up for you!} and soft and airy bread with parm and dipping oils. For the appetizers, we ordered their famous Meatball & Salad {a MUST! I could probably eat this for my meal}, the Eggplant Stacked made with house made mozzarella {ANOTHER MUST}, and the calamari. We were honestly full after these apps but then the REAL meal came! I ordered the Chicken Sicilian and it was so delicious. Chicken tenders, mushrooms, capers, and hot cherry peppers. Warning, it does have a kick but I love that! The entrees do not come with a side but I ordered a side of spaghetti so that I could taste their famous marinara sauce. The entrees are HUGE and if you order apps, I highly recommend splitting them. I also tried my friend's Veal Piccata and that was delish too! 

All in all, a VERY great experience. Pro Tips: Order an app or two, share entrees and a few sides. This place is pricey and you don't want to be left with a ton of extra food like we were because when you're on vacation, leftovers go to waste! :)
Excellent.  Staff is very friendly and Jeff the GM is outstanding.  If you haven't been please go.  Great Vegas experience with amazing food!!

The veal piccata is $34.00
And the spaghetti piscatora is $38.00
Oh my the best veal piccata was the best I ever tasted....!
The wine sauce was amazing...!
It came with two nice pieces of veals...!
And the spaghetti piscatora came with a lot of seafood...!
I was surprised...!
Brando was our server and the service was too good!
Wow! The manger came and checked on you....!
At least once was in Vegas trips...!
Worth every penny!
Been here many times and the food though expensive is awesome. Jeff and Nate were terrific and very personable. Highly recommend the short rib pasta.

The server did the best that he could given the restrictions of the menu and lack of substitutions (even with an allergy). The food is bland and overpriced. There are FAR better restaurants in Vegas to spend your money in.

Martorano's can't decide what kind of restaurant it wants to be. Its both tacky and faux elegant. Its kitchen is open yet its ingredients and prep are very basic.  Its prices are high and its quality of food is middle at best. 

Steve Martorano is painted as a South Philly goon (Posters of him with "Yo Cuz!!" in large print are plastered everywhere") who somehow learned how to cook despite no formal training. You will see his book, his image, and videos of him talking about cooking during your time there. It's like walking into someone's ego. They are really selling this guy's image along with the food.

The Ego would be fine if the food matched it. Or, at the very least, justified the prices. 

None of the food was bad, but it wasn't very good either and, at about $50 a person, I'm hard pressed to recommend this place when there are SO many better Italian options on the strip in the immediate vicinity.

This is a straight to the point kind of joint. The menu is the menu, no substitutions, no hold this or add that or sauce on the side. Just order and eat. That's it. 

Best parts: Cadillac Margarita, strong yet tasty. Meatball, GREAT flavor. House made mozzarella, yummy. Light up menu, nice touch. Bussers were nice and efficient. 

Decent parts: Everything else. Cesar salad, nothing special. Calamari, nothing special. Veal Marsala, below average. Spaghetti pescatori, lots of seafood, but just good. Gnocchi, bland.

Bad parts: Over priced, shoot em up movie playing on the tvs, no outside drinks allowed (not even cocktails from the casino bar). Not offered fresh Parmesan cheese and no salt or pepper to be found. 

We would come back for meatballs at the bar but that's about it.

I love going to different restaurants when in Vegas, but a must stop is Martorano's! Never have I ate such a delicious carbonara than here! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The staff is always friendly every time I have visited. Definitely a place to check out if you haven't!

First, I probably would never return because of the level of noise from the music.  We could not hear each other talk.  And as the night got longer the music got louder.  That is all part of the atmosphere we were told.  They do a great job of pulling off a Philly-style place, but we did not enjoy that.
The food-ourparty split the meatball and salad, and the eggplant salad.  Both were wonderful, along with the warm bread.  I could have stopped there and been satisfied, but order a special for the night entree-a short rib dish-disappointed,  the flavor was not good, pasta was bland, and all was too salty.  My husband had a special-seafood dish, loved it.
Others liked their choices.  My monitor was great.
Service seemed good because when the staff was at our table they were attentive, but when we wanted the check and when my food came a couple minutes after the others the service was slow.

Sorry to say the music level ruined it all.

Great:

Bread
Calamari Appetizer
Linguini & Clams, portion too much
Scallop Special, portion a little light
Fried Peppers

Not so Great:
Service
Fusilli Pollo, portion too much

Didn't have dessert, but they looked great at other tables.

Better choices around.

Get the calamari. It's sooooo fresh and soft. You can cut them in half with a fork they are so soft. We are mostly used to frozen calamari so having fresh calamari is night and day. I would come back just for the spicy calamari. The staff is so professional and attentive. The atmosphere is great with people walking by gawking at the beautiful plates presented from this restaurant. There is a 3 course meal for 50$ or look to spend about 60-80$ per person for dinner, appetizer, sides and drinks. Also try the mini ice cream cone sampler for desert. Is casual wear for men and women but I saw people in shorts at dinner time.
Amazing food! Bryce and Rudy were fantastic servers. Highly recommended if you're in Vegas!

Just amazing Italian food I had in the long time.

Perfect temperature with fresh everything.   I would recommended 100%.

Hands down the BEST restaurant in Las Vegas! From the service to the food was just simply AMAZING!  Our waiter Brandon was Top Notch! From the homemade mozzarella, eggplant, meatballs, spinach, sea bass, bread, speciality drinks..... ALL extraordinary! Spent my birthday dinner here and it was worth every single penny. Take my word for it, this is the SPOT in Vegas for the best dinner in town!
