We dined at the Paris Hotel location.  I just don't get it.  The food is average at best.   The waiter and the manager were both obnoxious.  It seems to me they are all just Gordon Ramsay wannabes.  "Yo cuz".  Really?  How stupid.  Go somewhere else.

Great Place , food is as good as Ft Lauderdale the original .
Every dish is amazing 
Dessert is amazing

I've eaten here at couple of times in the past and the food here has always been very solid. This time was no exception.  They have a weird policy not to bring out any bread until the food has been ordered.  Maybe many have left after filling up on their bread and then decided not to order.   So once we ordered our food they brought out some of the bread served with romano cheese, olive oil and a spicy oil to dip the bread in.  We started off with the bibzy fried calamari.  Tender and delicious with a sweet n spicy sauce sprinkled with sesame seeds.  

I opted for the protein side of the entrees and ordered the veal piccata.  A generous portion of veal that was ohhhh so tender and delicious.  I could easily cut it with a fork, no knife needed.  The veal was sitting in a delicious sauce of wine, butter, lemon, olive oil and surrounded by tasty capers.  The meal was very filling and by the time dessert was offered I was too full to partake.  I'll definitely have to save room for some tiramisu the next time around.

Me and my home boy just had some grub. We had the ribeye cheesesteak and meatball and salad combo. The chef hooked us up with some sesame honey glazed wings.

But in all seriousness... Service was great, food was awesome, drinks were delicious. Highly recommend this place!

I made a reservation for my team dinner at Martorano's last week and we had a great experience.  All of the details were considered (including the light up menus - love!), the service was impeccable, the decor was modern, and the food was fantastic!  I started with a peach martini - perfectly mixed and quite tasty.  I shared a caesar salad and fresh burrata to start - spot on!  My entree was the penne with vodka sauce and it was sinfully good.  We shared a panna cotta with fresh berries to close out the meal and it was perfect - light and delicious. Definitely worth a visit when looking for Italian comfort food on the Strip!

Messed up my (simple) order and took a long time to get it right. Waiting so long for average Italian food is nothing to be impressed about. 

The place has a good ambience.  That's probably the best thing.  The service was just okay, not even counting the messed up order. 

The food was okay and good presentation. However, very overpriced. The pasta noodles were of good quality.  The sauce was nothing special. (I got the red "gravy" with the meatball. The meatball tasted fatty. 

The Manager did come over and apologize for the mix up on my food. 

No way would I take my wife here for a nice dinner. Much better places in the same price range. 

It's not romantic. It's not special. It's overpriced.
Amazing food and service!!! The spaghetti al pomodoro and chicken Marsala were delicious!
Amazing Italian food. Service exceptional. Try the veal scallopini. Prices a little high but we'll worth it. A must if you are visiting Paris Hotel.

Outstanding meal. Venue is fun and different. Had the fried mozzarella with a home made meatball on top. Fried mozz was definitely the best I've ever had. Meatball and sauce were the bomb! Linguine and clams for my dinner- simply amazing! This is one of my favorite dishes and it was outstanding. My husband had the chicken parm with a side of gnocchi. All phenom. Would definitely recommend! #YoCuz

If I could give this restaurant a 1/2 star, I would. The service and food were less then desirable. The menu items sounded delicious, but the actual food served to me proved to fall short of that. While I have never personally met the chef, I can tell you the ladies in my neighborhood church have better gravy and better meatballs then this place. 

To make matters worse, the management was completely uncompromising and pretty much ruined my best friend's birthday. 

We had a moderately sized party with a special request to order two meals and appetizers separately from the rest of the group. The waiter informed us that they could not do that and that they WOULD NOT DO anything to assist. He sent a manager over and he said he could do nothing for our request, and due to the owner, appetizers could not be ordered separately from our meals. We explained to two different managers our situation and they regretfully informed us that the owner refuses to make any exceptions in how his restaurant is run. Management did nothing to accommodate, even when the situation was explained to them over and over again. 

If you want good Italian food I can recommend several other places that severely beat this place. Picasso, Sinatra, Andiamo, Nove, Casa di Amore, MAGGIANOS, PIZZA ROCK, BUCA DI BEPPO...literally pick any other Italian restaurant and you will be happier. 
 
Furthermore, if you have any business colleagues, clients, friends or family that you plan to recommend here, don't.

Steve Martorano and his restaurants will never have my business again.

Great food and awesome service. Water glass always full, waitress came back many times to check on us. Place was pretty busy.  Set us right away with our reservation. Chicken Scilian was very good and pasta was very tender.

Went for dinner. Sat at the bar Evis great and takes care of me. Starving but wanted something quick
 Caesar sale fresh dressing great. Philly cheesesteak sandwich surprised me. Meat was delicious great bin. Will try and ho back before I go.
Managers always seem to stop buy and ask how everything was.

Wow!! From Jeff the host who was helpful and friendly on the phone, to the hostesses when we arrived.... the bartender was spot on with drinks....Paul our server was on top of his game and he handled us RI gals pretty well lol the gentleman helping Paul was so nice as well.....food was delicious and will highly recommend!! Nice touch for the manager to stop at the table as well!!
This was our first visit to Las Vegas restaurant. We've eaten at Steve's in Ft Lauderdale. Experience was amazing and waitress Jessica was amazing. Would recommend for foodies

The very best in service but the food took very long to prepare on a slow night and it came out with little flavor.  highlight was caesar salad but price and flavor didn't match up.  Better places to go for italian.  oh yeah, bread was good but time to prepare courses meant we ate too much of it.

No need to look for a better Philly Cheesesteak in Las Vegas because you won't find one. The meatballs are second to none as well. However, i do like Carbone's meatballs a little better, just my opinion lol I love nothing more than Italian American cooking from South Philly it reminds me of growing up in Jersey and my grandmas Sunday gravy every weekend. Shout out to Chef Steve Martorano and his commitment to serving the highest quality ingredients and employing a top notch staff. 
YO CUZ!!

Dishes I recommend:
Philly Cheesesteak
Meatball Salad
Sunday Gravy with Macaroni 
 First Cut Veal Chop

To make a long story short - great everything! Great service, great menu, great drinks, great fresh daily mozzarella, great decor, great location.... and the list goes on. We had a large party of 10 and we loved where we were seated. 

You know how you go to dimly lit restaurants and the older people in your party can't ever read the menu?! Welp, no problem here because the menu is digital! Fancy! 

I dare say that you will not go wrong with anything you order. Everyone in my party was ecstatic with their meal and raved about it. I had the most divine braised short rib pasta! I still dream about it. The drinks are great as well. 

It's well worth it. I paid for my date and I believe for the two of us ,it was only $200 with drinks. The dirty martini is excellent and I got some sort of pear basil drink that was delicious. Next time wine for sure because the gentleman sitting across from me said it was delicious with his steak. I tried both and he was absolutely right. Can't wait to go back!!
All I can say is: terrible , really bad. A simple cafeteria food with a higher price. If you can avoid it do so. Not worth it.
Excellent experience. Everyone is very helpful and courteous. Seated quickly and food was very good quality, quantity, and value.

Excellent service and food was incredible.  Great atmosphere with upbeat music.  Bar was very impressive and cool!  Wine list is pretty awesome too.  The servers attire is very New York !! Highly recommend this place

Loved our first time here. Came highly recommended from a friend who grew up in Philadelphia like the owner here. Everything is fresh and delicious. Prices are very reasonable for LV. Meatball salad app and a eggplant stack app a must. Chicken Parm dinner was spot on.
We went here for dinner and enjoyed it! The carrot cake was "to die for!" The atmosphere is nice!
Great dinner and great service.  Pricing are Vegas high but overall the food and service were better than most.

Excellent service and scrumptious food.  Meatball and salad was perfect appetizer.   Attentive service never let my water glass go below 3/4.  And the pasta.....yum!  We ordered the bugatini and it was cooked perfectly al dente.  When in Vegas , head to Paris casino and dine here

I'm actually surprised to see this restaurant has less than 5 stars. I have been in Vegas for about a week now for a convention and out of all the restaurants, this place by far had the best service. I came with 3 people and we did a tapas style dinner. We ordered a bunch of appetizers: calamari, meatballs, and mozzarella, which were all delicious! Our favorite was the calamari, which is perfect for anyone who loves spice. I was also really impressed by our server who came by and split the appetizers evenly for us. It was the right balance of quality and service.
Fantastic dining experience - the staff was spot on and the food was excellent. Try the meatball!

The ambiance was nice with blue undertone lights and disco balls. They have tvs so it is not your typical fancy Italian restaurant. They were showing sports and old movies which we enjoyed. The bread was soft but got cold fast however they make sure it's replaced quickly.
Our server was nice and fairly quick with service. 
The chicken parmesan was delicious and the penne vodka was simple yet tasy. Overall we enjoyed our experience.

This is hands down one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas! The Chicken Parmesan is phenomenal with fresh mozzarella; the gnocchi are like little pillows of heaven; the meatball/salad is a must-order. Even the olive oils that accompany the bread are worth raving about.. hello red pepper infused oil. It's one of only a handful of Italian restaurants I'd ever recommend. Our server Paul & all of the staff were nice, helpful & attentive. (P.S. I'm posting from the table because it's so good you have to know now!)
Wow.   Holy Crap.  I just had the best Italian meal ever not only Vegas but anywhere .   I would give this place 6 stars if I could
Excellent Italian restaurant modeled after East Coast Italian! Bryce took very good care of us! Pasta excellent!

I'm half Italian. My Nana raised me on homemade and handmade pasta, delicious meatballs, incredible gravy, sumptuous salad. She was a spectacular cook. Although she passed on to the great kitchen in the sky, I keep her alive by cooking her recipes and enjoying many of the dishes she would make for me.

So why do I begin my review of Martoranos with that introduction? 

Two words - the meatball. Italians do not order meatballs out. Your family's meatball is part of your heritage. No one else's can come close. Or that's how it is supposed to go. 

Sadly, the meatball that Chef Martorano cooks puts my Nanas to shame. That is almost sacrilegious to say but there - I've said it. There's a reason this restaurant is famous for its meatball. It's AMAZING! 

But I'm getting ahead of myself. Let's start with the cool decor of the blue lit bar and the plasma TVs all around the restaurant showing Classic movies or the DJ playing tunes to dine by. 

We ordered the meatball and salad appetizer and were blown away by it. Our waiter also suggested the made-fresh-that-morning fried mozzarella in gravy which was out of this world. 

For our main course my lady had fresh fish over risotto. Loved it. I had veal parm with peppers, onions and gravy that was phenomenal. The side of ricotta gnocchi was light and spectacular. 

This was one of the best Italian meals I ever experienced. Hands down the best meal I had in Vegas in years. 

Service was 5 star. The meal was 5 star. A MUST for lovers of great Italian food!

I love the Martorano's in the Rio Hotel! I am a Steve Martorano fan, for sure! 
I was excited to try this new location.
My mom was in town so I thought it would be perfect!

It was not perfect, but it was really good. And I am sure once they settle into this new location it will become amazing, like we  are used to at the Rio. The food was good, although it took a really, really long time to arrive. The service was good in a awkward, trying to hard kind of way. 

My mom did not lover her entree, unfortunately. So we asked for it to be boxed up, because she only ate 2 bites. Both the waiter and manager knew she did not like it, and after the long wait, If I was the manager, I would have probably comped it. 

I am looking forward to going back in to have some amazing Italian food.
Once the "New Restaurant" jitters are gone, and they have there Martorano's mojo going!

I have been here multiple times.   I went there this last week and I was highly disappointed. I mentioned my problem with one of our two servers.  Nothing happened.  Then I also wrote about it in the electronic comment section that comes with the bill.  Nothing so I decided to leave a review.  

I will start with another patron was extremely drunk and causing problems he was in the table next to us.  It made it hard to enjoy our dinner.  Secondly, they brought me the wrong salad but they fixed that and brought me the Caesar salad I ordered. The problem is it was bad.  The lettuce had many wilted pieces in it and the croutons were mostly stale.  I usually love their Caesar salad.  I quit eating it and showed it to the servers assistant who was helping our table.  They did not do anything about it.  Our entrees were good to a point. I have to say that over all it was a bad experience.

Ok, I have to admit that I was skeptical of eating here just because of how dead it was during prime dinner hours. However, I am happy to announce that I was wrong & anyone that doesn't try this place at least once is missing out. LOL! I had been craving a good beef carpaccio for a long time and that was the 1st thing I saw on their menu. Their service is awesome(we sat at the bar,) their pours are heavy, & their food is top notch. My husband and I shared the fried mozzarella that was topped with a delicious marinara, and their creamy penne pasta that had peas, mushrooms, and chicken. YUMMMMM!! Their pastas and the rest of their dishes are all homemade. No frozen stuff here! The atmosphere was superb as well. I love the lighting. Perfect quiet spot for a cozy dinner date. We will definitely be back!

I do not like rating places 5 stars because not too many things can be as goood as it gets.  But, this place is......As Good As It Gets.

The atmosphere is nice, the service great, and the food is incredible.

Yo Cuz Steve was there in person watching his crew cook up the food.  I lucked out at the seating because I could watch the events of the staff as I enjoyed the Company in my party.

The eggplant stack appetizer was pretty darn good.  The speghetti pescatori was outstanding.  

The prices were not cheap but not out of this world like some of the other nearby places.  If you pay decent money, you want decent food and this was the case here.

Steve was especially busy during our time here because NFL Quarterback, Joe Montana was dining a few tables over.  But he took the time to come over and talk to us.  This was really special to one of us in our party as he is a frequent diner at his Atlantic City location.  He is one huge dude and takes his craft seriously.  It was nice meeting him.

I would highly recommend this place.  I will be back!
Ordered prime rib sandwich and it was good. Meat was juicy and tender and the hoggie was fresh and it came with au juice.

My wife and I enjoyed the food, very attentive wait staff. No substitutions and Insistent on ordering everything right away, I like to get  appetizers and see how full I am before completing my order but it worked out ok.  Not inexpensive but quite enjoyable.

Had my brother's wedding reception here.  Staff was incredible!! Very helpful, kind, ready and willing to serve! Kept regular drinks filled and we're always around to get you anything you might need.  And food was amazing!!! We ordered appetizers, salads, meatballs, spaghetti, and the chicken Sicilian!! Everything tasted incredible but the the Chicken Sicilian... forget about it! It was amazing!!! Order it now! So incredibly flavorful and tart! My mouth is watering again thinking about it! Mmmmmmmmm!

This place is great !
  Came in and was greeted by hostess immediately, bar / restaurant had some old Blk/Wht movies playing.  My guest was super impressed with the light board menus. Manager came by the table during my meal to thank me for business.  Great vibes just like the spot in Frt. Lauderdale.  Your going to want to grab an order of Rice Balls, Truffle Fries, Clams Casino, Tagliatelli and a Veal Parmigiana and a glass of Barolo.  Thank me later.
Mediocre service makes for a poor experience...especially when the restaurant isn't nearly full on a Friday night in Vegas. Fails to live up to its hype.

If I could give 7 stars I would. The best Carbonara I will ever have in my life. I'm positive it will never be beat. My boss ordered chicken parmigiana with a side of spaghetti. Everything came out at the same time, at perfect temperatures and cooked to an astonishing perfection. I can't remember the name of my mixed drink, it was pear flavored, was a dream. The waitstaff was very attentive and knowledgeable without ever hovering. I highly recommend

My mother and I came here for lunch, around 11:30am. We had never been here before and wanted to try it out. We had a really cool server, and the drink I ordered was amazing. Except the fact it was kettle one, and $14. Not cool. The salad was good honestly. Then the spaghetti and meatballs came out. The meatball (yes it is just one huge meatball) and honestly, it was not that good. Anyone can simmer some tomatoes and put salt in it. I was not impressed. And it was $27 for tomato sauce. I do not plan to go back here. Ever. Save yourself money seriously.

Definitely one of the best dinning experiences I've ever had and the food was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! The staff was excellent! We started on night off with the meatball salad and egg plant stack which both were so delicious. The meatball had such and amazing flavor and the egg plant was cooked perfectly. Then for our Entrée we had the carbonara and I must say it was fantastic! I highly recommend visiting this place. If you don't mind spending money on delicious food this should definitely be the go to spot!

Absolutely Awful...I just wish I would have read reviews FIRST.. I would have never have gone.
SERVICE... Ridiculous. They were not even busy and they let us sit with our menus  menus closed for some time. 
FOOD...so NOT good. You know how when you are eating Spaghetti  and the oil is overwhelming? Yep... That's it. Awful

Please please SAVE your MONEY.
I suspect they are struggling. I wonder why?
Why don't they try and listen to the customers reviews ?

Here is your chance Management... Email me and ask me to give you a full report....
I will be happy to help.

Our family had dinner at Martorano's in April, 2015. Most of the entrees were in the $25-$35 range. Two of my sisters ordered the special which was grouper. They both enjoyed it till they received their bill - $62 each! I realize they should have asked the price, but still, I think the waiter could have given them a clue.

If you are looking for a quick bite go out on the strip where quality and excellent service isn't important. Everytime I am in Vegas I eat at Martoranos because the food is excellent the service is EXCELLENT the atmosphere is excellent and if you the type that believes you get what you pay for then you will see and taste the quality you paid for! The warm Mozzarella is to die for and basically everything else on the menu. Its obvious that Mr Martorano prides himself in running a class act of a restaurant because I will NOT eat anywhere else because Chef Martorano and his staff at this location care and it shows big time!! Give it a try you wont be disappointed! All these negative reviews I think are incorrect or fraudulent regarding service and times for food delivery because NOT ONCE  in the over 20 times Ive been here have I waited more than 30 min max.

My sweetie and I had dinner here for the first time last night and were blown away by how fabulous everything was. From the atmosphere to the service (Paul is an outstanding waiter who is both friendly and knowledgeable) to the food, it was simply top notch. The Caesar salad is big enough to split and the dressing was flavorful. Both pasta dishes we had we perfectly cooked and seasoned. Wine was reasonably priced considering the quality. This place gets it right on every level. We will be back!

my wife and i have eaten at martaranos for years...and we keep going back....its simply the best italian food in las vegas... we ate at martaranos on 5/18/17 for my wifes birthday.....our waiters raymond and juanito were excellent....top service...always checking to make sure that everything was alright.....the food was superb...i am of italian heritage....my whole family is from italy....and i can verify to you that martaranos food is 100% authentic italian food.. they use the finest ingredients...and there recipes are right on the money...the restaurant itself is beautiful....well decorated...the manager mike was very cordial...making sure that our dining experience was total satisfaction...then to top it off i found out that martaranos takes off 20% from your total bill including liquor, for all local residents....awesome way to end the evening....i highly recommend to anyone that wants excellent italian food, to try martaranos...you won't be sorry......its phenomenal.......

Love this place, my only reservation is the service has been hit or miss.  I have favorite servers now.  

I'm from Philly, and let me tell you their $18 cheesesteak is .....worth every penny.  It is absolutely the best.  Their meatball is spectacular, my only issue is; why the heck they charge extra for a tablespoon of ricotta.  That kind of stingy-ness as well as the inconsistency with service is the only reason I cannot give them a 5/5.  
   
Overall, I have never not been happy with their food.

And locals....there is a discount!!! Great place to go.

Horrid atmosphere, amazing food!

I have never found a restaurant that I loved and hated so much at the same time.  This is an example of a Las Vegas vanity restaurant with an 'experience' I would avoid at all costs but food that begs me to come back for more.

We were seated inside of the restaurant late in the evening, exactly at the time we reserved our table.  The staff were friendly, attentive and professional.  The service staff had spot on recommendations for drinks and appetizers. Stars all around for everyone.

Inside the restaurant was clouded with vanity pictures of chef Martorano in poses that show him as the 'Boss' he apparently is.  Music from the 90s was being pumped through speakers so loud the servers had to shout the specials and signature drinks, and even that was not good enough to hear anything they said. 

Much worse, a string of scenes from Martorano's favorite films were loudly played on TV screens throughout.  Scarface, Rocky 3 & 4, and an old Steve Martin film were forced down our throats as we tried to enjoy delicious cocktails.  Why the TV's?  I felt like we were at home watching bad cable.

The food, however, oh the food!  Are you kidding me?  We ordered four items from the regular menu and specials, and everything was just amazing.  Super fresh, top of the line meat, seafood and pasta.  The standout was a sea bass special, absolutely melt in your mouth perfection.  The pasta was perfectly prepared, just as promised on the menu.

Martorano's is loud, loud, loud, so go for great dining with somebody you don't want to talk with.

Food was just ok service was bad. Ordered calamari was tough. For the prices they charge would not go back. Nothing worth shouting about. Water was always empty. They can't service the whole table at one time bring out food when done each plate what a scam

This restaurant was amazing. The service was great, the food was drool-worthy, and my colleague and I felt well taken care of the entire time. We had the fresh mozzarella, calamari, and shared a chicken Parmesan special and the carbonara. I have nothing bad at all to say about any of the food- every bite of everything was amazing! - but my favorite had to be the calamari, a perfect blend of sweet and spicy without being overbearing. Definitely will be back next time I'm in Vegas!

Extremely overpriced for the quality they deliver. I ordered the carbonara and it was doused in salt and heavy cream. For $28 a plate, you'd expect something more than a heavy slob of cream, plated in a manner that looks like it came out of a cheap cafeteria. Very disappointed. DO NOT RECOMMEND!

If you are VEGETARIAN , do NOT EAT HERE.. They have nothing for you, the chef won't even make alterations.  We were very disappointed, the prices are ridiculous and the food isn't even worth it... The manager tried to get us to come back again and try their fish, I was like no way... The food is really BAD....you can find a million better Italian restaurants.. When a place tells you we cannot make anything vegetarian, its trouble, I have learned my lesson.. The decor and the color scheme of the restaurant  is awesome, too bad the food sucks....  I  was very disappointed. I don't mind paying for good food, but when the food is bad and overpriced its horrible... DO NOT GO HERE...

Nice surprise here in Paris hotel. Really good bolognese, pasta, they even created an Alfredo dish for us that the guy said was best he ever had. Good bread, good atmosphere and good for business dinner.  A little slow on service at the table. Fantastic bartender last Thursday night so lots eating at the bar.

Didn't even eat here. Had a reservation for 7:30. Stood there for 15 minutes and no one helped us so we left. This place is a joke. I've eaten here before and the food is not that good to stand there and wait like this. Never again.

Review only for drinks at the bar--- Great bartender! Sat down and was quickly presented with an iPad of all the various drink options. Lots of cool cocktail combinations made expertly and quick. Really impressed with the fast service here because so many other places I've been to here can be quite slow. Bartender was also cheerful and friendly. Will definitely go back for drinks. Only draw back was a bunch of obnoxious investment bankers lurking at the bar, but I can't really fault them for that.

I will start off with the food was incredible! The service was mediocre at best...the server seemed preoccupied and self serving. One the menu, everything seemed in line with the pricing you would expect with added sides. But  everything is ala-cart ($10 for side of spinach and $12 for side of spaghetti) and served in plates that are their own separate full plates so you are reaching three plates over to get your vegetable or pasta.  For the price and service the food greatness does not make up for the other ineptness!  I would not recommend  this restaurant with so many others in the vicinity...if I could have, 2.5 stars and a pass! Never again.

Would definitely recommend this restaurant. We ate here on a Friday night and we ate a little earlier in the evening. The atmosphere was nice and was not too noisy which I have grown used to in Vegas. We ordered our drinks and I had the Black Beauty (at least I think that is what it was called) which was fantastic. For dinner my boyfriend ordered the lasagna and I ordered the bolognese. They were both delicious and very good portion sizes (I usually have trouble finishing a pasta plate but I was able to here). We really enjoyed the televisions playing old school Vegas movies like the original Ocean's 11 movie. For dessert we had their homemade ice cream and that was also a wonderful addition to our meal. Will be returning on our next visit!

The food here was phenomenal. Raymond and Francisco helped us out with some recommendations from the menu and took the the time to explain everything. They were a great team and kept us happy throughout the meal. I tried the watermelon martini Raymond recommended and it was great. The pasta was cooked perfect as was everything else. Started with the calamari appetizer, chicken parm, risotto, you name it. It was all great ! Unfortunately we didn't have the appetite we should have coming here but I will definitely be coming back. This time with an appetite big enough to enjoy dessert afterwards. If we're lucky we'll get stuck with Raymond and Francisco again :) they were awesome!

We really loved this place inside the Paris! We came here twice while on our vacation and both times we sat at the bar while they were only serving pizza and salads. The Caesar is to die for seriously! And the pizzas are unique and delicious. Great for a little bite mid day around 3pm. Both times the bar tenders were exceptional as well and made it a truly nice experience. Next time we are in vegas I'm sure we will be here again.  Ambiance is cool too with the blue lights!

PHENOMENAL, I had the Chilean Seabass and I was with party of four, the rest had the stacked eggplant, (not a fan of the eggplant) but it looked good. The place is like a club as well; music were 70s-90s dance hits. Great music great food, great everything. Clean, Well explained about food and beverages, Well organized. I will be going back for sure!

We had a party of 6 last Saturday night and I ordered the lasagna special the waiter was quick to note that they do not have the special available they were out what Italian restaurant on a Saturday night on the strip runs out of lasagna at 7:30 so I ended up ordering penne alla vodka dish and I asked to substitute for a different pasta he said he would check got back to me said no they do not do that . You would think they would help me out since the lasagna was already out.So when the dish came it was not penne alla vodka wasn't even close wasn't even edible the waiter was more than accommodating to exchange it but by this time I lost my appetite I managed to call the manager over and and 
asked him what restaurant at your caliber runs out of lasagna on a Saturday night at 7:30 he said he only makes 15 pieces of lasagna per night the restaurant holds 125 and if you have two or three turnovers that's a lot of people I asked him why he cannot do substitutes on pasta he said that's their policy .At the end of our meal the waiter said he took my dish off the bill like he was doing ME a favor that is horrible customer service every time I go there I have a fantastic time but this time it left a bad taste in my mouth probably the alla vodka hard to say if I will return

A sad duplicate from the greatness in the Rio Hotel.  Staff was rude, my dinner plate had finger prints on it, my wine glass had lipstick. 
We were being sea
One cocktail menu to be shares by 6 of us, and you only get to see it once as it bounces from table to table.
My food was bland and tasteless.

I was really impressed with the food at Martorano's in the Paris Hotel. The decor is quite modern with specials and cocktail menus displayed on iPads and a light up menu.  The customer service from the hostess to the waiter were all top notch.

THE FOOD WAS DIVINE!  I tried the caesar salad, linguine in white clam sauce and the homemade mozzarella with olive oil.

I don't suggest this place for a romantic date night but for a fun night out it fits the bill with fun music and stellar food.

For the cost it would have been nice to not have all the buzz and noise from the casino and for Martorano's to have it's only restroom which is why I deducted a star.

The food is really good but I think it's expensive for what you get.  I had the meatball and salad and hubby had the meatball with spaghetti (their version of it).  Pasta was cooked to perfection and really good.  The staff is friendly and is located in a good location in the Paris hotel.

My family and I had dinner here tonight in the paris hotel. Food was nothing special. Pasta had hardly any sauce on it and my sons riggi pasta dish was real hard and under cooked.  The atmosphere is a nightmare . Music blasting it have us a horrible headache could not wait to get out of there.  Why would anyone want to enjoy a nice meal with blasting music. We could not even talk to each other it was that horrible !
Food was good. Eggplant stack amazing and homemade mozzarella to die for! Service was impeccable!

Highly disappointed with the food especially after our waiter gave us a long monologue about using the fresh and best ingredients.  Brandon, our waiter is the only reason I give as many stars as i did.

I'm a big fan of fresh pasta so when I heard this place imports from Italy I was super excited to try it. But it was mediocre from start to finish and not worth the price we paid. 

My husband and I like to be adventurous so we started off with the pigs feet. This was a little too fatty for me but the sauce was adequate and it was interesting to try. 

Afterwards, we weren't sure what pasta to get so we thought we'd split the bolognese of the day. The picture on the menu made it look big but when it arrived there was not a whole lot there. I thought the pasta was extremely underwhelming for supposedly "fresh pasta". 

Because I'm a glutton for punishment, I decided to order the carbonara which I thought would be better. It wasn't. Pasta still tasted stale to me and the sauce was underwhelming as well. 

Overall we felt that the price for everything just wasn't worth it. Yes it's the strip and you're gonna pay more but for this price we expected top notch pasta. I felt like the meal was comparable to any run of the mill pasta place on the strip that would be cheaper.

Second time here and was amazing just like the first time. I have tried many Italian restaurants in Vegas and this one is by far the best. Prices are extremely reasonable considering how great the food is. If you like Italian, you must try this place. I would give it 6 stars if I could.

First I'd like to say that the atmosphere is very relaxing and enjoyable. Sadly however, I can't say the same for the menu options and service. The menu lacks selection and customizability. I asked if the spicy sauce on a dish could be substituted and he said "no we don't customize orders." I then asked if their was another dish that included paste, with chicken, that is not spicy. He replied "no". I can't believe that they can't customize an order that costs upwards of $30 a dish. This establishment lacks quality and versatility that many younger individuals desire, due to this I would highly recommend overlooking this place and finding a more "family" oriented restaurant (save your money and time).

Went to Martorano's at Paris on Sunday 5.1.2016 and it was not what we come to expect of this place. We have dined most locations more than once; and this was by far the worst experience that we have ever had. Being from Philadelphia and fairly familiar with the cuisine and the restaurant itself. I will have to say that our waitress (Jessica) was excellent and none of it was her fault. We had reservations at 8:30PM and were not seated until 8:40 PM; everyone was crowding the hostess stand. We were finally seated and looking at our menu I order Veal Parmigiana with Gnocchi which I do every location. I was told at first that veal parm is not on the menu but it was on the menu outside the restaurant and every other restaurant that I have been to; but then I was told that they will make an "exception". Then moments later I was told that they were out of Gnocchi (I was the 24th order and they only had 23 orders). How do you run out of Gnocchi on a Sunday night when you have it on your menu and you are still open for another 2-3 hours minimum? This is not acceptable for a place that has reservations and is accepting walk-ins. I got my Veal Parmigiana and it was the size of my fist (which isn't that large) and it was very thick and had bones in it (not usual for Veal Parmigiana)  Martorano's was so much better atmosphere, presentation, and family like at the Rio;  at Paris I feel like its get in and get out not enjoyable.

This place was a joke!  We should have known the attitude we would get when the menu states "No substitutions", "Don't break my balls".  We went anyway because we were staying at the Paris hotel and needed an early meal before the show.  The atmosphere was very pretentious and awkward.  Almost every server that poured water or wine was a nervous wreck and shook like leaves.  We asked for butter with our bread and they brought one pat on a little dish for 4 people!  The wine was very overpriced ($19 for 4 oz.).  The meal was mediocre, especially for the price.  I'm used to high prices for fine meals, but this one really was a disappointment.  I've been to Italy many times and no place treated us like this one did.  My sister asked for salt when they brought her meal and the waiter insisted that she taste it first and stood there while she did it (she still wanted salt!)!!  They made you feel like they were so superior in their knowledge.  I would never recommend anyone go there!!

This place looks fantastic! The service once they get to you it's very good. Definitely not worth the hype. I would almost rather go to Olive Garden. There is not a single thing here that I was impressed with except the meatball salad. It is enough for two people to share and has great taste! Had the chicken parmesan and was definitely not impressed. They brought out the wrong order at first and they made it right but by the time they came back I was so full on bread it did not matter that they brought me new food period was not able to eat it anyways. Had a few bites and it was okay period then packed it and gave it away to the homeless. Martorano's you guys really need to step it up. The appetizers came out at the same time as the entrees. They sat us very quickly but the waiter took 20 minutes to come say hello. Once we started eating we realized something was not right and it took them an additional 20 minutes to come but that was only because we waved them down. I think you guys have a great place on your hands, a few tweaks would bake it so fantastic

Came here for the first time on St.Pattys weekend and absolutely loved it. This past weekend, I brought some of my friends who are big "foodies" in as we flew in for a few days to see Elton John. They had the best time and the food was excellent again. The bartenders are fantastic - went above and beyond when I asked for a cucumber martini which by the way was perfect. Make a reservation,  go an hour early, sit at the bar before you are seated at your table, they won't disappoint.

The food was okay at the most. Definitely not worth the price. There was no Frank Sinatra nor R&B playing, as it was said on the menu's introduction. And the cockiness of the chefs statements on the menu's cover makes you lose your appetite. His arrogance is second to none. 
Service was good. 
Will not come back.

We enjoyed a really terrific meal. My wife ordered the salad with meatball and I ordered the pepperoni pizza. Great portion size. Very tasty meals. Quick lunch service. They have Lagunitas IPA and I enjoyed that, too.

My wife likes the Matarano story, bought the book, I kind of read a few parts. Great story, pretty good recipes, and was pretty excited to try the new place in the Paris. Went for lunch and was impressed by the trendy upscale decor..Had sports and a n old gangster movie on the t.v.s. I like both so cool. We ordered the bucatini carbonara and the bucatini meatball with red gravy, and truffle fries...both pasta dishes were pretty good. Carbonara had the white Parmesan sauce which was my favorite, other one was pretty solid with one good sized delicious meatball..good but $28 at lunch time good???not sure..Truffle fries were flavorful slash a.little salty..$80tab for lunch seems to make me not like it as much as I hoped..Maybe I'll return for dinner to give a fair review..Cool and friendly waiter was a plus..#yocuz Lower ur lunch prices..haha..

Our excellent waiter, Paul, put this review past 3 stars. His manner and passion for the food was entertaining and informative. The food was good...not great and if it weren't for our waiter and the ambiance I'd only give it 2 or 3 stars.

My friends and I were craving some good Italian food and decided to try Martorano's. It is not really inexpensive, as pasta prices seem a little high.

Our appetizers and server was amazing! The spicy calamari was the best that I have ever tasted! The meal portions are very large so the waiter recommended family style so we all ordered a few items and split it. It was all pretty good, and the service was polite and helpful.

We've never heard of this place until one night when we were desperately looking for a place for dinner while on vacation in Vegas.  I'm glad we went for it.  It was a good experience overall, however the 4 stars are mainly for the service and the calamari appetizer.  I know some people complained about it being soggy because of the sauce but I think it's the sauce that *made* the dish!  It's different from any other typical calamari appetizer I've ever had at most restaurants.  It's lightly breaded and fried, but they put a slightly sweet and tangy sauce on it that made it completely different in a good way.  I ordered the seafood pasta with red sauce (I forget the fancy dish name) and the seafood was obviously very fresh.  I would pick this place over some of the other "celebrity" Italian restaurants in the area.

An hour long wait, despite having made reservations more than a month in advance - we were originally seated on the "sidewalk" outside the restaurant, with casino guests stumbling past mere inches from our table. Make sure you ask for a table inside the restaurant, but not under the house speakers - it was so loud, we couldn't even hear our waitress, who immediately screamed over the noise, "Yeah, people complain about the music all the time!" Do they, now?

We started with the Fried Calamari Bibzy ($20), which was a conflict of textures - some of the larger pieces of squid were completely melt-in-your-mouth tender, while other pieces were crazy rubbery - even the waitress quipped about the half-eaten portion when she finally arrived with our drink orders.

The place has a fantastic wine selection, featuring some really nice and inexpensive offerings, including several of our favorites from the Conundrum Winery by the glass - and we received some awesome suggestions from the sommelier, who had to scream his selections over the music. 

My wife's Linguine with White Clam Sauce ($32) arrived under a thick layer of Italian parsley - so much so you would have thought someone dumped a lawnmower bag over the plate. And while the pasta was perfectly cooked, many of the clam pieces were gritty with sand. By the time my wife called it quits, there was such a pile of parsley "clippings" floating in the remaining broth, you couldn't see the bottom of the plate. 

The Veal Piccata ($34) was tender and the lemon butter sauce was excellent. Just don't forget to order a side of pasta, because everything is a'la carte - an important fact that was either not shared with us, or we simply missed the detail while the waitress attempted to scream over the music.

Oh, and don't ask for salt or pepper - "The chef seasons everything to perfection." Maybe for his pallet, but the veal would have certainly benefitted from a tiny sprinkling of salt.

Once again it did not disappoint.  We got our favorite chicken Sicilian and this time we tried the New York strip steak with sharp provolone and peppers. It was AMAZING?. Cooked perfectly. We also tried the greens which was spinach sprinkled with bread crumbs with big cloves of garlic. So good.

A real comedic event 

A good menu, but a bad excuse of a restaurant and a really poor Las Vegas restaurant management team!  Really sloppy - their dress, their presentation, their view on food / service, etc, etc, etc 

Just ok service - rushed and unrefined 
The food is good, but It is not great by any stretch.  You experience is overshadowed by the management / service.  

Find your good customers and don't rush them.  

Overpriced even for Vegas. No regulars here, but just tourists who are drawn in unknowingly.

2 years and the location will likely turnover to-another entureprienoer.          

Not worth a return trip based on the management, presentation, price, rushed service and poor leadership.  

Too many other GREAT options.

Very surprised by the 3 star rating. My wife and I give it 5 stars!   Everything was delicious,  from the meatball salad appetizer  to the chicken parmigiano.  My wife had the special California  sea bass with lump crab. Setting was perfect and service was superb!

The ambience and the location of this place is amazing . It has an indoor and outdoor seating arrangement .The staff is very friendly and co-operative .

We ordered chicken fussili and a caesar salad , both were good and very filling .We had to take to-go boxes. An authentic Italian restaurant !! Will come back for sure !

First time in Vegas- wanted to eat well. I love Italian food. My son suggested this place as he had been to it at a previous location. He told the waiter we would start with appetizers and then decide on the main course. The waiter said that he could not take a partial order - we had to order the entire meal at the beginning. I said - I may want dessert... he said we had to decide then. If I had been in my hometown I would have asked for the manager and had a discussion with him about how ridiculous this was. Instead we just ate our appetizers and left - we went elsewhere for our dessert. What a shame.

I reserved my table as Albus Purcival Wulfric Brian Dumbledor and the hostess totally got it.  That made me happy. Great food. I had the meatball. I put that salty ball in my mouth and I was beside myself with satisfaction.
The bucatini  pasta  with a meatball was phenomenal.  Truly  a great dining experience  coupled with a fine wine list. Service could have been a tiny bit better but food was  outstanding.

Really enjoyed dining here at the Paris hotel. I had the meatball salad and the carbonara pasta. My husband had a rigatoni special. Delightful martini choices. Canolli was okay. Pricing is excellent for the quality of food, Vegas experience and the name alone. We will definitely go back.

Fabulous food here!  Wait staff is very attentive and friendly.  We greatly enjoyed our experience with Brandon and the bartender Jenna.  

Our first night here we stopped in for a drink and dessert.  We saw someone else enjoying the Cesar salad and knew we had to come back.  The following night after watching a show, we returned....

The Cesar salad is splendid!  Beautiful presentation with large shaved Parmesano-Reggiano pieces on top.  Bread is served wth olive oil, grated Parmesan, and chili oil.  

Desserts.... No words, just yummy feelings. We tried the chocolate cake with cream cheese frosting the first night and the following night plus the tiramisu.  Delectable!  Flavors do not disappoint.  I want that tiramisu recipe!  BEST ever...

Atmosphere:  There are TVs playing Vegas mob-type movies with subtitles, music playing, Several disco balls glittering in the back.  The blue colors are inviting.  

really cool modern menus... Backlit!  iPad/tablet technology used by wait staff.

This place is awful. I suggest visiting this restaurant only if you enjoy getting an instant heartburn from house salad dressing that consists out of straight up vinegar, consuming overcooked chicken in Marsala sauce that's saltier than the Pacific Ocean, or washing it all down with a glass of Pinot that must've come out of a cardboard box for $5/gallon. To top off your experience, you will wait 1.5 hours for your course to make its way to your table and your dessert will be unavailable at the end of your meal. We came in with a party of 8 people and not one of us had a single positive thing to say about this place. Maybe this restaurant should try to focus on food rather than pretending to be high-end with poorly written iPad apps that aim to replace the drink menu.

Absolutely phenomenal service and by far, the best Italian food we have ever had. The homemade mozzarella is delicious and the pasta cooked perfectly. The meatball is out if this world. Cannot more highly recommend. And big shout out to Raymond for making our first date night as a married couple absolutely perfect!!!!

My wife and I are here last night and it was absolutely amazing!

The food there is made to order and tastes just like grandma used to make, I couldn't hardly contain myself from ordering more food just to try it. This place has an amazing menu and great quality food, not to mention a very home feel to it, even though its upscsle.

The wait staff is professional, curious, knowledgeable and also very concerned with making you feel like your home. ( as for Paul, our entire menu from drinks to entree were of his choosing and we couldn't have been more satisfied)

To start: the bread and dipping sauces are just amazing. We ordered a homemade mozzarella and tomatoes antipasto, this was to die for! 4 layers of handmade cheese with thick, fresh and ripened tomatoes between them, fresh basil and a 20 year aged balsamic vinaigrette. 
I cannot say enough about it.

We also ordered the chicken parmesan that was on special with a side of pasta and their famous meatball....OMG it was amazing! The chicken was perfect, topped with fresh ricotta and mozzarella, not to mention the fresh tomatoe to round it all out. The pasta, always served (al dente) has changed my view on how pasta should taste and that meatball... was worth every stretched out millimeter in my stomach.

All in all, this place was worth the money and time spent, we will be visiting here again on our next Vegas trip.
Fantastic great food and obviously the message not to break his balls about his cooking applies. Great service great wine list. Just a pleasant meal all the way around.

Dined here with my boss on a Tuesday night approximately two months ago. Attention from all staff was wonderful, the food was delicious and the atmosphere was nice as well as we were seated outside. I had some sort of pasta (Can't remember the name but similar to the spaghetti and meat sauce) but it was one of their evening special plates, it was delicious! All ingredients were super fresh and the portion size was perfect.  The bread with oils, vinaigrette and spicy sauce was delicious as well.

My husband and I stopped by Martorano's this evening before going to see Garth Brooks in Las Vegas at the T-Mobile Arena.  We started off with the fried mozzarella appetizer which was the best appetizer we have ever had!   Then we split the Carbonara and it was also delicious!  Our server, Chris was very knowlegable and personable!  Overall, an excellent meal and we will return!

Went here for a birthday dinner. Food was great! Chicken Downtown was delicious! Eggplant stack and a meatball for appetizer was also great. But what really stood out was our server Brandon, super nice guy and extremely knowledgable about all the menu items. Everything was excellent.
Excellent experience. I had the scallops while my husband had the veal and both were fantastic. I would recommend and will return when in Vegas. The wine by the glass was surprisingly good.

The American/Italian "Philly" style food is delicious across the board. Meatballs, Pastas and Parm style dishes flood the menu and are all very tasty. The restaurant is a relocation or spin off of Cafe Martorano's which was at the Rio for many years. I think this is an excellent restaurant with one severe drawback. At night (weekends?) they turn up the music obnoxiously loud as if it's a night club. It's not a night club, it's a restaurant that becomes impossible to have a conversation in. I have never seen the restaurant packed when they do this, as it clearly drives away more traffic than it attracts.

The Good: The food was very good. Sauce had notable flavor. Wine list was decent. Service was good.

The Bad: over hyped a bit. It was good but about what you would expect. I had a hard time moving from very good to exceptional.

The Rest: overall a nice stop and if you don't mind the higher price associated with vegas fine dinning, you wont be disappointed. If you fine dine frequently you will be satisfied but probably not wowed.

The food here was disappointing.
The service was good but I would probably not come back for the food. Maybe, I'm just not the right type of customer.
There were there for dinner before going to see the new Inferno magic show.

We ordered, the fried calamari, spaghetti with meatball, carbonara, and cheese steak, and a salad.

First of all, when I order calamari, I expect it to be crispy and temperature hot. The sauce that they put on the calamari made all the pieces soggy. Have you had soggy calamari at a restaurant before? I haven't. This was the first time.

The spaghetti was fine. Nothing special with a giant meatball. For $25 or so for an average bowl of spaghetti wasn't worth it. If the sauce was more flavorful, then sure, but really, I could have made that spaghetti. The carbonara was okay, but I think they must have used swiss cheese, or the combination of cheese they used wasn't as good. It was very strong. I love parmessan, gruyere, asiago, etc. but whatever the combination was - was something that I personally didn't like. The Philly was okay, as well, but nothing special.

Usually price isn't a factor, but when the food isn't great, then it becomes an issue, because it wasn't worth it.

If I had known, I probably would have gone to Maggiano's instead.
Oh, finally, the salad. It was swimming in dressing. I ordered the Maggiano's salad for $14. It was just that - lettuce and some tomatoes. I am being critical in that the world of restaurants has made so many innovations in salad that a $14 salad shouldn't be a small plate of greens with dressing that I could have bought at the grocery store. 

I love great food and expect it when it is billed as a fine dining restaurant. Mediocre is right. I make better pasta at home than this restaurant. I don't think the chefs understand that people's palate's have changed. We're used to eating at so many great pasta restaurants - Nora's, Buddy Vs, Maggioni's, Wolfgang Puck, and a few more - gosh even California Pizza Kitchen, and I'll say Buca Di Beppo have some solid dishes, so this place is a great disappointment.

This is located in the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas. The atmosphere and the servers are great. But the pasta and seafood dish I had was very spicy. I didn't enjoy it nor did I finish it. Also shouldn't they be playing French music rather than American pop? I enjoyed the Malbec wine.

Great service, very friendly staff, intimate ambience. Food was so delicious. I got the shrimp bizby and it was to die for. Perfectly seasoned and cooked, not rubbery or bland at all. The next dish was the meatball and fried mozzarella...again, perfectly seasoned and cooked. I tried some martinis and they were not weak at all. Wide selection of beer and liquor. It was very cozy and romantic, yet somehow it was lively with music and people - perfect balance! I went two nights in a row during my stay at the Paris and it will certainly be my go to place when I'm in Vegas again.

Best Italian restaurant on the strip!!  Beautifully displayed and gourmet cuisine!!  Love their fresh mozzarella and risotto. Scallop and crab dish so delicious!!  Great atmosphere with old movies showing on screens throughout The restaurant.

I was excited to have the opportunity to finally eat here. The atomsphere is dark and modern. I loved it. Our waiter did an excellent job giving us all info necessary on the food and the establishment. He knew the menu very well and explained the items in depth like a pro. I got the meatball and salad for starter. The meatball was huge and made to perfection. It was topped with an incredible red sauce and a nice side scoop of smooth ricotta cheese. It was surrounded by a delicious italian dressing topped salad. For entree i got the carbonara. The serving size was more than enough and it tasted so good with the cream sauce and egg yoke. I have no complaints. None. Next time i'm in Vegas i will be a repeat customer. This place lived up to all expectations.

This restaurant was a  big disappointment, it looks very nice from the outside but the menu, service and food were really very poor.  I ordered the chicken marsala which I have eaten at many restaurants and it didn't come with pasta, mashed potatoes or vegetables, just over salted pieces of chicken.  My girlfriends pasta wasn't any better and the prices for two salads and two meals and one glass of wine was $137.00.  We should have gone to Maggiano's just down the street we would have had a great meal for about $40.00.
Food is so good here!! Great staff. Me and my wife had an awesome birthday meal thanks again to the chefs and front of the house. We will come back soon.

My wife surprised me with dinner place at this place last night for our first time. I was super excited. Been wanting to try this place for a few years and we are locals! 

We got seated fairly quickly because my wife made reservations ahead of time. The ambiance was great. Romantic and classy yet hip. Our server was great. Very knowledgeable of the menu and personable. His assistant and the GM were great. Everyone who waited on us was amazing. 

I took off a star because the bread wasn't all the great and my chicken parmigiana was kind of boring on the plate. As for the taste it was pretty good, but I don't think it met my expectations for how much each dish was. 

I would still recommend though. It was a great date night place.
Seriously delicious. If you're in the area and hungry for an awesome Italian meal, definitely check out Martorano's new location on the Strip!

Here is the bottom line, if you like your pasta cooked Al Dente, then you will probably like the food. But if you don't like pasta cooked Al Dente, then your out of luck, because they will not cook it any other way. I am not fond of Al Dente, or not being able to have my food cooked the way I want it, so 3 stars is the best I can rate this restaurant. I had the rigatoni in Sunday Gravy (sauce) with pork, and the gravy is very good. I also ordered a side of meatballs (which they give you one large meatball for $12). It was OK, but I have had a lot better and it was certainly not worth the money. The bread served with the meal is authentic delicious Italian bread, served with sides of oil, hot pepper sauce, and grated cheese (although I wish they also included butter as a choice as well). The decor is very sleek and ultra modern, and although it hardly fits the theme of an Italian resturuant, it is a nice looking place. The prices are high for an italian resturuant, but when you take into consideration your eating at a celebrity chef's restaurant, right on the strip, the prices are fairly reasonable. There are certainly many better Italian restaurants in Vegas, but if your staying at the Paris, and don't feel like leaving the hotel, you can get a decent meal here (as long as you like Al Dente pasta!).
80s disco Italian restaurant. Yeah you read that right. A total gimmick and a bit cheesy but the food is really good. If you need a meatball while listening to The Bee Gees, then this is your jam.

Had a horrible experience, first of all our bartender at the bar was ver rude and helped other people at the bar before us. Had he been Sincere and helped us during the course of our drinks. The experience would have been better had he only given me a water, really ruined the experience at this place. I'd be happy if they went out of business because of this horrible experience. Took an hour to even be able to get an appetizer.

First time visiting the one at Paris Casino and like the one at Rio Casino they never disappoint. I had the special: Rigatoni Bolognese and it was the best pasta dish I've had at any restaurant. My wife had the Chicken Parmigiano and she said it was the best she ever had. Of course started the meal the world's best tasting meatball.

The server Mike, the manager John and the cook was the most professional and beyond approach when it comes to service. The chef made my dinner twice cause he didn't like how the first one came out and you don't find that commitment to quality and detail like that anymore.

If you come to Vegas and miss this fine dining establishment then you are definitely missing out. Don't walk but run here for a fine dining experience.
Everything we had was wonderful. From the cocktails, to the salad and main course.  I would highly recommend to anyone in Vegas.

The only good thing about this place is the service. And it looks nice and has a cool ambiance. Besides that, don't waste your money. The portions are small and it was nothing to write home about. We ordered the calamari as an appetizer and it was like $20 and came with like 10 pieces of calamari. Seriously? For $20? I thought they were feeding mice. The entrees were nothing special. We had the chicken permigliano (however you spell it). It comes with no sides!!! And it wasn't even good. It was a fried piece of chicken with cheese on top. Seriously don't waste your money. This place sucks. Overpriced and they are greedy with their portions. I only gave it two stars because the server was really nice. But they try pushing you to buy more (sides, alcohol, etc.). I felt like I was looking for a used car.

The only way this dining experience could have been worse if if the food totally sucked. It wasn't great, and the service was horrible. We ordered drinks and waited over 10 minutes to receive them. We ordered another round and waited even longer. When our meal was served, the entrees came out at different times and my 'salad and meatball' appetizer came out several minutes after everyone else causing their entrees to be cold by the time we ate. After speaking to the manager, twice, he told us that they serve the food as it comes out and that was the way it came out...not my problem! And the restaurant wasn't even 25% occupied. The food wasn't great, just passable, so all in all, won't be going back there again...ever!
Firs time there had the best veal parmigiana ever. Second time there had the worst veal parmigiana. They need to have consistency with their chefs   So disappointing will not be back.

Best pasta I have ever eaten at a restaurant. I had the Bucatini Carbonara. It was rich, but flavorful and addicting. My gf doesn't even like pasta, but she was impressed with the bite I made her try. I highly recommend this dish and this restaurant. The service was on point. Our server was very professional. The drinks were fantastic too. Lemon drops. The appetizers we had were the Eggplant Stacked and a meatball and cheese appetizer I can't recall the exact name. Both dishes were fantastic. I would recommend the Eggplant Stack. Trust me...
Overall I had a great experience. I will be a returning customer. 

PS: they have a strict no altering dishes rule. If you're the type that likes to modify your dishes you will not like this place. That being said, I wouldn't change a thing ;)
Great dinner and service! Veal Park and Lobster were fantastic. Orders all desserts for a birthday and they brought it all out with great flare!

Ah, where should I begin? This place started out rough and only went downhill. Our party of 8 had reservations and the restaurant was not all that busy for a Saturday night...now I understand why. We were told that we could not be seated until all 8 members of our party arrived.-Strike one. We went to the bar to have a drink, but it took so long to navigate the cute little iPad menu that all of our party arrived before we could order a drink. At least we were able to sit at our reserved table. We then sat and waited 15 minutes for a server...did I mention it wasn't that busy? When he did arrive, he impressed us again with an iPad drink menu...for 8 people? Really? I asked for a paper menu and was told that it was not updated. Strike two. Good news, we did get water after 25 minutes! The server was pressuring us along after he made US wait?!? Strike three. I haven't even tried the food yet, and honestly don't care if I do. It's like a nightclub more than a restaurant. I would have asked my fellow diners if they felt it was loud too, but you can't hear each other at all. The noise level is LOUD! Skip it and just go straight to the club.

We came here just to try the caesar salad because we heard  so much about it. I must say it was excellent, one of the best Caesar's we've ever had. We also had the shrimp appetizer which was just as good. Bryce and Umberto took excellent care of us. The next time we come we will be sure to ask to sit in Bryce's section. We would highly recommend this restaurant.

If you want to spend $161.00 for food that tastes like Olive Garden then eat here.  Be careful with the waiters daily special. My Chilean Seabass was $62.00, now I think he should of mentioned that when I was looking at ordering the veal for $28.00.  I'm a foodie and I don't mind spending the money on good food but this is nothing special at all.  You pay for the ambience and food presentation.   I learned my lesson - always ask the price of their daily special.

The extremely poor service outweighed the delicious food. My daughter had just turned 21 and we were in the mood for some fine Italian food so we made our reservations and arrived right on time. We were seated, but no server was to be found for about 10 minutes. We had no drinks, or water. Finally our server Raymond came over and introduced himself, he was pleasant but dismissive, not even apologizing for the wait. We understand the restaurant may be busy, but maybe more waitstaff should be hired because one server can not handle 12 tables at once. We were looking into getting a bottle of wine and he asked us if we were staying at The Paris Hotel. We said no, but staying at The Cosmopolitan across the street. He kept trying to sell us something we did not want but insisted and made us try it anyway, still not liking it we ordered what we originally wanted. Took another 15 minutes for our bottle of wine to come and be served. 
The whole time we noticed the table next to us was a bunch of high rollers, and got anything they wanted. There was every server, bus boy, sommelier helping them the entire service. Our server was barely present the whole time, and was mainly focused on the table next to us. A sommelier did not even show us the bottle of wine that we ordered. Then it came time to order our food, and we were excited because we heard the food was amazing and it certainly did not disappoint. Our first course came, we got the meatball salad and it was divine. I noticed though that every other table that got salad got it served to them by their server, in which we did not. Not a big deal, but bad front of house service for sure. Our main entrees were fantastic as well, we got the chicken parmigiana and veal parmigiana. Excellent food, kudos to the kitchen. Overall it was extremely poor service, which is very upsetting due to how good the food was. 

Will not be returning due to the service.

If I could choose 0 star, I would do that. 
We  were yesterday, Sunday the 25th table of 7 people. 
We had the worse server ( The blond lady) with attitude and over 'I work by the book'. 
Just to mention we are Diamond guest who spend 10-20K a night in the casino. 

First she said on what ever we ask to change or add or remove from a dish ( My wife is pregnant)  ' No! I can't. You can see in the menus no changes at all' and after I asked a few times to ask the kitchen and begging , She came back and said 'oh it's ok the will do it for you'. It happened a few times. 

Then one of the pasta dish wasn't cooked, And we know more than her one or two things about pasta, She said it should be like that. 'If you wanna change and make a new one it will take you 40 min for a new pasta'. Are you serious !?! She didn't want us to order a new one. 
And so we said yes, And guess what? It took 20 min, half of the time she said. 
When we said we don't want it because of her bad service, She was  laughing on front of our face with the manager. 
One more thing, The pasta is not fresh, and costs 35$ and up for a poor basic marinara pasta. SHAME on Paris hotel that they let this restaurant to be opened there!

Don't go there. Poor menu, WORSE SERVICE. 
Super expensive, You better go eat with this prices at Gordon Ramzi restaurant or Mom ami Gabi, X10 times better value for your money , 10X better menu and food quality and the most important you get an excellent service there.

Unfamiliar with Martorano, I was pleasantly surprised with this restaurant.  Overall, the look has a very modern/trendy feel to it, though admittedly a little confusing with the random mob/action movies playing on all the TV's periodically turning up over the sound system for certain scenes, only to fade back into the dj's mix.  Food wise---I enjoyed the meatball over fried mozzarella. The meatball was sizable, tender, delicious and of course fried mozzarella---what more need be said.  My entrée was the lasagna which is better than average, but not necessarily anything to get too excited about.  What I did quite enjoy, however, was the wife's risotto with shrimp and scallops.  Quite possibly one of the best things I've ever tasted.  The risotto was so buttery and rich with each bite--completely flavorful, and the seafood cooked perfectly.  If I were to go back, I would certainly order that.  The price point was a little high, but as expected for this sort of restaurant on the strip in Vegas and certainly not outrageous.  Waiters were attentive and food brought promptly.  Overall good experience.
Came here solo (long story) while in town. Server Paul was charming and informed and made me feel welcome. Delicious food, fun music. Loved it and will be back!

I was impressed with the atmosphere of this restaurant. The decor is pretty upbeat and unique. They have several tvs which play old movies and at some point they dim the lights and play loud music. It's a pretty fun place if you are in the mood to party. However, if you are not it can be very dark and too loud for dinner. 

They have a large variety of dishes. I highly recommend the homemade mozzarella. There are a few dishes with it, so you have several opportunities to try it. For my main entree I ordered the tailgate pasta which comes with ground beef, veal and pork. The dish is super meaty and the pasta was perfectly cooked. 

For my dessert I ordered the carrot cake. This dish was good, but easy to forget. Unfortunately they do not have a lot of options for desserts. I felt the five options available were very mediocre.

The service was also ok. The staff was friendly but it took about 45 minutes to get our main entree. Overall, a good option if you are feeling like having Italian food with a great atmosphere.

I had wanted to try Martorano's for a while as it seemed like it would be a great dinner spot.  While restaurants can be hit or miss, they did everything right from start to finish.

We were promptly greeted at check in, as was every party arriving.  We were lucky to have Paul as our server.  What more can I say than "wow" about his professionalism, knowledge and hospitality.  He spoke about the menu with a sincere passion for his role as ambassador to our table.  With items I would never order (vegetarian) he spoke about the menu with such confidence and intimate knowledge that he was sharing an insiders look more than just suggestive selling.

The menu was amazing.  Paul prepped us for a fabulous ride and it did not let us down once.  The freshly made mozzarella made it a necessity to have it to start.  We had their version of caprese and fried mozzarella that was evident that everything was made fresh and with love.  Indeed Paul's presentation of the menu was a love story and homage of the chefs vision and passion. 

Portlons were abundant and full of flavor where you savored each bite.  Penne a la vodka was exceptional and chicken dish huge.  While the menu consisted of fresh and simple ingredients, it was the symphony of flavors and presentation that made it perfect.

Overall, a great experience from Start to finish and I would not hesitate in recommending it!  I can't wait to return!

" FAST FOOD IN PARIS"

Guest of this establishment during V day 2016. Was excited to spoil my gf to fine dinning VEGAS-STYLE.  What we experienced instead was fast food fine dinning at it's best. It took more than a few minutes for our waiter to introduce himself and serve water.   We ordered philly steak sandwich and Shrimp spaghetti. As expected from menu we were asked to be patient for food, as it was "made to order".  We received what I felt was market prepared bread everyone boasts about.  

After more than 20min when the food finally arrived I was pissed!!!  The philly sandwhich ($18.00) looked like a complete mess.  I felt that it was purchased from Costco frozen food sandwhich.  The spaghetti was warm-cold not hot as I expected from a freshly prepared entree.  Shrimp was prepared perfectly, wild caught.  The calamari was a F'n JOKE!  It was frozen.....Yo Cuz!  You fed me a frozen entree??????

When it came time to pay this establishment inquired about my experience.  I gave them a "D" rating simple fact that it was terrible!

I gave this establishment 2 stars for two reasons; Incredible ambiance & MGR inquiring about our experience prior to completion of our meal.


I will not be returning.....

Five stars is difficult for me to give at eatiing establishments, but Mataranos really delivered some knockout flavor profiles.  The service was top notch, the menu is simple but elegant. Get The Cheese!  Because WOW and you are welcome!

I'm glad I did not read the reviews before i went.  I thought it was great

The girlfriend and I went for dinner after a show.  We were seated near the bar, with a view of the walking area outside the restaurant and could see into the restaurant as well.  The music was interesting, not what i would expect, but since I was a child of the 80s, i enjoyed it a lot.  I guess they have a dance floor as well, since they were playing a lot of 80s and 90s hip hop and dance music.  I liked it, but we did not dance...

I thought the food was good.  We shared the Fusilli Pollo and it was enough for two of us, with an appetizer.

We had good service and the price was good as well

It's not a chain that you see in every town, and that's what we were going for.  And it was close to the hotel...

Oh I'm sorry but I cannot leave this a bad review at all when I came here to this particular location with my friends from New Jersey we happen to walk by right as they were opening the restaurant and what do you know it was like we hit the jackpot lottery
I swear to God it was crazy we were there first table and chef Martorano was there! 
He kept coming toward table and bringing us food that we didn't order
There were other tables in the restaurant that were two tops but it was so strange because I didn't think that we were the first actual people to be seated I think that maybe we were there first party of six
It was my girlfriend Sheridan's birthday that we were celebrating I didn't get the bill if there even was one but my friend had said that the chef had hoped it up somehow it was crazy I'm sorry but I thought the food was good and I will never forget how this big jumbo macho Italian guy with the muscles came up to us and were so friendly and was talking to us
I'm not sure that even realised it was Chef Martorano at that point until we had left
 I don't know about these other experiences but I had a nice time plus the booze always helps

My group comes here each time we visit. The food is always great. Love the cheese steak, scallops, and chicken Parmesan. Raymond and Francisco were fabulous servers, we had a group of twelve and they managed us very well. Wonderful food and great service!

Love going to the spot great service great energy great atmosphere I had the seafood fra Diablo delicious Evis was the bartender or waiter did an outstanding job also the bread with a hot olive oil dip was ridiculous

This is not authentic Italian. But it's authentic NYC Italian. There's a difference. You don't want to go here for an authentic Tuscan dish, but if you want some spaghetti and meatballs, or what I had - the rigatoni with short ribs in "Sunday gravy," was amazing. There's a barrier between comfort food and high-end cuisine in Vegas. But sometimes you don't want a $100 steak...some home-style pasta and sauce hits the spot. And at $28 for my entree, it actually was a very affordable place with n upscale feel. My meal at Martorano's was exceptional. Filling and delicious.

My only complaint is that the drinks are ridiculously priced. I paid $28 for my entree and $26 for 2 Jim Beam drinks (their house bourbon). Sorry, but Jim Beam is not a $13 per drink bourbon. Especially when drinks are measured exactly in jiggers and the bartender doesn't have the option of making it a bit stronger to please the guest. I'm not so upset about the booze content except that they weren't able to make a drink to my liking because it was 75% mixer.

Next time, I'll do beer. Safer and cheaper. But overall, love this place. Affordable but still pretty upscale. Down to earth with the food, but the drinks are outrageous. I'm basing this review solely on the food - not the drinks. Five stars all the way for food, and this is a restaurant after all, so I'll let the drink prices slide.

Service was impeccable! Make a reservation and no wait! Food is to die for... Large portions so come hungry!  Wine list awesome and reasonably priced. Thank you for a perfect meal... We will be coming back soon.

Great service! The food was good-- a little pricey. We ordered the calamari, sweet and spicy shrimp, and the salad for appetizer. They were all great. For the main course-- we got the chicken, steak, spaghetti and meatballs. The meatballs were a little salty.

Overall, the food was good and service was great!!! Took off one star for the price -- as it is not a fancy restaurant with a steep price.
