Great wine. Weird atmosphere. Inside Paris on a fake paris street. Calamari was excellent.  Service was good. Over priced. Ordered the lobster. Good enough. Would never come back here. So many better restaurants. So expensive. And a stupid atmosphere.

The best damn Italian I've had since I was back on the Least Coast!! Service was excellent - the Veal and the Pasta (Bolognese of the day) and Salads were simply delicious and just perfecto. Multo Beni boys!! We will be back whenever we can. In Vegas Italiano is a must and this may be the very best in town.

The only reason why I making this a three star review, is the fact that the meatball salad was off the charts and the wait staff was very courteous. They're claiming the best chicken Parmesan in Las Vegas, if that's the best then I'd hate to see the worst because it was soggy and not very good at all. We had the flat pasta bolognese and it was so salty it was barely edible. I will eat there again solely for the meatball salad and the Motz appetizer.
Great food, exhuberant service in sidewalk style but filteted noise and little smoke.

I really disliked this place, and most of the food we ordered.

The decor is nice, black and white. With blue lighting along the bar and the kitchen, which is open (about a 1/3 wall) at the back of the restaurant.

The environment is odd. From the outside it looks like a typical classy restaurant, but once you're in it's a different story. "Yo cuz" is plastered all over the place, I'm guessing that's the chef's catchphrase. Several tv's around the room were playing Mystic River (a great movie but would not be my first choice for a dinner - the concept of having a distracting t.v. while in an " elegant" restaurant was off-putting) while funk and disco music played a little too loud.

They try to be trendy and modern, the menus are backlit and the server brings over and iPad that he uses to go over the specials and which serves as a cocktail menu/shop/dessert menu, but doesn't actually serve to order.

The servers were very professional and friendly, and provided their recommendations when we asked.

The fried mozzarella stack was very good, but a bit pricey. $22 seemed a bit much.

The main courses were not very good particularly when factoring in their cost. $28 for what amounted to 6 chicken fingers in marsala was a bit steep, and the carbonara, although a generous portion, was not very good either. The risotto was a little too al dente for my taste, although the portion was generous.

There are a lot of better dining options in Vegas.

I was able to go here with my uncle because he had a free meal voucher here through Paris.

I enjoyed my experience over all but I feel like the prices do not match the ambiance. The ambiance looks like a lower class Italian restaurant whereas the prices match something more elegant. I feel like they couldn't decide which direction they wanted to go in. 

I ordered the three course meal paired with wine. For the first course the wine was paired with the food but for the next two courses our food came before the wine. I feel that the wine should have been brought out first so I could enjoy it throughout the whole meal instead of having to wait for it. 

I also wanted to order a coke but our waiter was never in sight. I probably saw every other server but him. He was nice but I just felt he was absent when we needed him. (Side note: I never ended up ordering the coke.)

The food was good though. I started with the meatball which was tender and paired with red sauce and peppers. For the second course I ordered bucatini with red sauce. That was also good and I was lucky enough to have leftovers to take to work the next day. For dessert I ordered their cannoli. I loved it and paired with the sweet dessert wine it tasted really good. 

Good food, just ok service and ambiance. 

I enjoyed it here but just sub par.

Reservation is recommended!

Our server, Brandon, was very good. He made sure our food and drinks were served on time. 

The busser/assistant was also great! Very on top of his game making sure we had our waters and our plates were out of the way. 

Food was of good quality. The pasta was perfectly definitely al dente. 

They're very accommodating about birthdays, so don't be afraid to ask ;)
Cuzzzzz... best Italian restaurant ever. Atmosphere is good and the food well... you can't get better Italian anywhere in Vegas. Evis is a world class bartender who remembers your drinks and order:

Mozzarella was excellent!!
Spaghetti al pomodoro was a work of art !!! Beautiful!!!
Affordable pricing with quality products

Great service & excellent food. The fried Mozzarella is out of this world good. My wife ordered and enjoyed the Penne ala Vodka, and I had the Braised Short Rib Bolognese. Both were delicious. We will be dining here again. Chris the Jewish / Mexican was our server and was  so much fun attentive. Cheers.

there was a lot of hyperbole regarding this eatery, so we had to give it a go.
when we entered this establishment, our party of four were seated in the main dinning area, much to our chagrin, we were greeted with a cacophony of music, blasting at extreme decibel levels! really?  it was so invasive, that we could not hear ourselves think, let alone carry on a conversation, between consenting adults.

 i thought obama had outlawed excessive sound torture, were we to be waterboarded next?  also, there were these funky lights, swirling non-stop throughout the room, really? therefore,  a person is not only unable to speak to your guests, but because of the lighting, you couldn't see them! really?
  
as a result, we were moved to the outside dinning area, thank you god!
once outside, we could at least take advantage of our vision, hearing and remaining senses and  engage in the social pleasantries, associated with fine dinning.

our review of the meals met with mixed results; the appetizers of meatball (yes only one) with a salad, was very good, as was the fresh mozzarella.  however, the main courses of eggplant, ordered by two of our party, was over salty and appeared to have been made sometime in advance. this is against their freshly made food mandate, listed by the owner on the menu, really? they were going to return these dishes but since this place is run by a former mafia chieftain, they decided discretion was the better part of valor and life. my meal, chicken sicilian, was one of the worst meals i have ever been served! the chicken was covered in a thick  sauce, which was made of primarily olive oil and grease! the peppers, which were supposed to add spice and flavor were uncooked! so this chicken dish should really sleep with the fishes, which they will also not eat!

the last dish of spaghetti, was enjoyed by my wife.
 
so if you desire to go to a place where you don't want to see or hear from your friends, family or associates, martorano's is the place for you, but not me!
Simply amazing! Food was excellent as was the service! If you like homemade Italian food you will love Martorano's.
Awesome food and great service. This is a must if you're in vegas!! The meatballs are truly famous. Our waiter Brandan was simply the best.

Food was okay. Bread was nothing spectacular; focaccia would have been much more appropriate. Fried calamari was good. Penne pasta with pancetta was nothing taste worthy. Saffron risotto was just eh. Service from waiter could have been more attentive, especially since there were several unoccupied tables for at least ten minutes.

Hostesses were helpful and friendly.

The chicken parmigiana was absolutely perfect. Large portion, great taste, excellent. I would recommend getting this.

Good service and setting. They also serve bread with olive oil. It is very good and super heavy, so coupled with the chicken, you will be beyond full. No need for a side of pasta or salad unless you want it or are sharing.

I give this restaurant a five stars, highly recommend for the food I had.

The service was terrible (the waiter ignored that I wanted tap water and "upsold" a huge bottle of flat, even though I was dining alone... $7.50).  He neglected to bring me a second glass of wine.  I had the 'special' of lasagna, the sauce had zero flavor (and they were very stingy with it), the sausage/meat mix was terrible, chunks of spice and then chunks of zero flavor.  The homemade mozzarella was good, but definitely didn't make the dish worth the $36 price tag.
If you are looking for excellent Italian in Vegas, keep walking.

Overall a good meal. Had meatballs, lasagna and scallops as our group shared. Scallops were a little overcooked but everything else was tasty and service was good. Our server was a little slow, but he tried given it was busy.

After arriving in our room at Paris about 8 pm, my daughter and I decided to eat in the hotel.  We don't particularly do steakhouses, but wanted a substantial meal to share after a long day of travel.  The lasagna was recommended by an employee; it was not on the menu.  There seems to be an "off the menu" menu which you have to know to ask for.  They were out of the lasagna so we chose shrimp over spaghetti with a lemon butter sauce and the "famous" meatball salad.  The meatball was dense and just ok; the salad was drowning in dressing and basically inedible.  The pasta dish was again just ok.  Mind you, we had no alcohol, one salad, and one entree.  The bill was in the vicinity of $88!  For that kind of money, I expect much, much more. Mediocre, at best.

This was AMAZING Place. The food was sooooo good. Our waiter Paul was great. A little bit of a salesman when it came to the menu. Trying to sell the food off the menu was pretty smart Paul. But great service funny guy. The mozzarella with the tomatoes were so delicious. The calamari was very tender and the fresh ricotta with meatballs was to die for. I am glad I trusted him because he knew what he was talking about when it came to the food. Everything was so fresh. I am so going there next time. I wish I can find a restaurant over here in the valley.  Never tasted anything like it.

Great service. The menus are tablets that are back lit for anyone who has trouble seeing in semi-dark rooms. I had the spaghetti with fresh tomatoes and roasted garlic, which was very good. The bread side came with cheese, olive oil, and a pepper oil - all of which were good. The room is filled with TVs showing old movies with subtitles. I'd  return to this place. Great service, great food, and a great location.

A friend of mine had came here a while back and he would always mention it to me. He raved and raved about it so for his birthday we made the trip out here. I continued to tell him that it probably wasn't going to taste as good as he remembered it but that we'd go anyways. 

The food is freshly made to order. The hand stretched mozzarella cheese was delicious until they brought our calamari dish out. I ordered a white sauce clam dish and well I guess I'm not a clam sauce type of girl. I couldn't swallow it down. It was too "fishy-scented" for me or whatever that even means to me. I did nibble off someone else pollo chicken pasta dish but honestly with appetizers that good it was hard to compare. The service was great and the bill was great too aka expensive. I wouldn't return because the birthday boy raved about a pork pasta dish that I can't eat. Never say never though maybe appetizer pit stop? Only time will tell. Yeah my review was plain and simple I guess it was just like my dinner.
Italian food is top notch. Have the meatball salad and the Chicken Sicilian, that's all you need.
This place was GREAT. shout out to the server MIKE, he was AWESOME. Also to the busser JAIME he was funny and very attentive.  the food was DELICIOUS!! The service was AMAZING. loved it all.

Yo cuz?" more like, "Yo clown!" I don't understand the hype. I couldn't even find information about this chef on Google. The Italian food was subpar. We had the salad and meatball, penne alla vodka, and chicken parm. The meatball was dry and hard. The salad was fresh and crisp, but we didn't enjoy the meatball sauce in the lettuce. The penne alla vodka was a good size serving, but lacked flavor. 

Atmosphere - Don't get me wrong I'm a millennial and we're attached to our phones, but the light up menus and ordering cocktails through an iPad was tacky and unproductive. The Disco Balls hanging from the ceiling and the large Virgin Mary statue was confusing and made me uncomfortable. If you're looking for good Italian food on the strip try LAVO or take a hike to Summerlin for Parma by Chef Marc

The only thing good about this restaurant was the food. Our waiter took our food order before even asking if we a wanted a drink. We were presented our "specials" on an iPad. Who wants to hear about a $52 piece of pork from an iPad picture. The place has sports playing on the flatscreens and disco balls hanging from the ceiling with waiters dressed as paper boys from the 40's. I have no idea what this restaurant is trying to be. Our waiter never came over to check on our meal and we were never asked if we wanted another drink. Our dessert was presented on an iPad. There's nothing 5 Star about this restaurant but the food.

We were in Las Vegas just recently and had heard about this great place from a friend. So we decided to try it out.  I had the Linguini with clam sauce and the calamari.  It was so delish!!  Our waitress, Jessica was awesome.  So friendly, knowledgable about the menu and gave us excellent service. She made our experience at Martorano's just that much better.  We will definitely be going back and asking for Jessica.

I came here to dinner for the first time last Saturday and it was AMAZING! Our server was fantastic; he was very knowledgeable about everything on the menu and gave us drink, appetizer, and entree recommendations when we couldn't decide. The rest of the staff (manager/hostess) were also extremely nice and genuine asking about our time in Vegas.

The meatball salad and veal piccatta were both absolutely delicious! 

Next time we're in Vegas, we will definitely be coming back. Top notch restaurant!

Service - A little stuck up.
Reservations - We went late on Friday night but none was needed.
Food - Hit or miss.  Overpriced.
1. Short Rib Bucatini Special - Salty
2. Penne Alla Vodka - Just not memorable.
3. Ricotta Gnocchi - Very dense.  The "gravy" was delicious.
4. Sauteed Greens - The spinach was perfectly cooked.

This place is preeeetttyyyy tasty. I was craving Italian food (meatballs specifically) and man am I happy I walked in this place. 

I saw at the bar, and was immediately helped. The service here was pretty awesome. I started with the meatball appetizer, and it was soooo good. That is a meal in itself with the bread they give you. The chili oil is really good, too. I didn't finish it all to save room for my main course. 

My 2nd course was the carbonara. They actually being out an egg to mix on top of the hot noodles like traditional carbonara. The noodles had a nice chew to them and the pancetta is really good. It's a rather heavy dish though... I could barely finish half. Needless to say, I didn't have room for dessert..... Even though I really wants to try the tiramisu. 

Overall, I would definitely come back! It's priced like the rest of the restaurants on the strip, but it's actually really good for Italian food.

The food was good. But the menu is overly, almost obnoxiously, strict. I'm sorry but if I order eggplant parm or chicken parm I should be able to order a simple side of pasta. My friend wanted to order red velvet cake for dessert she was informed it's only an option on the price fix menu. She also asked for mozzarella cheese on top of her pasta and was told no. Like I'm sorry since when is the chefs ego more important than the customers prefrence. Like get over yourself. Also while the decor is aesthetically pleasing the music is way too loud you can not have dinner conversation. It's a restaurant not a club. Unfortunately the restrictions are what left the lasting, bitter, taste in my mouth and therefore I will not be returning nor recommending the resturant.

Excellent food.  The wife and I shared the famous meatball and salad appetizer and eggplant stack and they did not disappoint. Very tasty and well seasoned. The main course of chicken parmigiana and seafood pescatore are both recommended. 
Wait staff was very attentive and knew there courses. 
Would highly recommend

Excellent vibe and cool decor. Their macaroni (aka pasta) is excellent. The veal Marsala here is fork-tender and flavorful. The Sunday Gravy is the owner's grandmother's marinara sauce and it is delicious.

This is a return visit as I was here last year and definitely wanted to come back. Martorano's never fails to please.  The food is superb as are the wonderful waiters.   They are attentive and cheerful without being overbearing. I will definitely make another visit here when I next come back to Las Vegas. This is my go-to spot for fine Italian dining.

Cool and fresh spin on an Italian restaurant. Located inside Paris Las Vegas, nearly between the Paris and Bally's casino floors.

This dinner spot is popular and busy! We lucked out with bar seating for our group of 4 around 645pm. 

Our bartender and server was friendly, attentive and informative. 

Started with the Angel cocktail. A sweet option.

Ordered the Chicken Cutlet Parmigiano. Delivered hot and fresh. Great seasoning and texture on the breading. 

Menu is high end. Average entree is $40.

Best to call ahead or reserve a table in advance.

For some strange reason, our concierge recommended this place for family dining with a baby. WOW. That couldn't have been further from the truth.

The food was pretty sensational despite it's high prices. ($14 for still water, really?) I had the carbonara, where the yolk was broke and mixed in table side. Our server advertised it as the best pasta on the menu and his description was right on the money.

The environment, however, was extremely odd. In the light up iPad menu, there's an excerpt somewhat warning of the restaurant's unique style of operation. White tablecloths and embroidered napkins suggest fine dining however TV screens playing movies with explicit content, an obscene amount of disco balls and gaudy neon blue lights complete the interior decorations. Very loud music bounces from current hip-hop to 80s pop to 90s r&b, with the occasional pause and dimming of lights to focus in on 90 seconds of the most vulgar scenes of whatever feature film is playing.

All in all, an extremely strange yet delicious experience.

I must have to say. If you love Italian food this is not the place for you. Husband and I went here last night for our Vday dinner.  One it was not packed and hostess sat us near the outside of the restaurant as if the place was packed inside and that was the only choice. Mind you they knew my husband is a Diamond member. After sitting there and no one offering us any drinks or anything. Finally after 15mins the waiter saw I was upset and I asked him to move us so we can enjoy the restaurant vibe. Then after being moved inside. 3 mgrs standing there doing nothing bug chatting and waiters as well. Just as we were about to leave waiter finally comes over and offers us a drink menu. 
So faster forwarding to our meal. 
We ordered the meatball salad. It was decent. Wasn't dry but nothing great. I ordered penne vodka and husband ordered the chicken parm. My husband is italian from Brooklyn NY. He judges any italian resturant by your chicken parm. We get our food. Husband looks at his plate and asked the waiter where is the gravy(sauce). Waiter says its under the mozzarella. Husband looks under was like what italian eats dry chicken parm. Waiter brings over a tiny side of gravy and husband again says. Chicken parm is suppose to have alot of gravy. Waiter says we can give you a side of gravy but have to charge you. At this point husband just wanted to eat. So he agreed. Get to my penne vodka. TERRIBLE! Penne vodka is my all time fav and growing up with italians back home in NY. This place should be ashamed to call themselves a authentic italian resturant. My pasta was hard the sauce was filled with onions and garlic. 
After a while. The manager comes over and asks how's it going. Husnand states about the Chicken parm. Manager says we serve chicken parm dry like that, just a little sauce under the mozzarella. Husband looked at him and couldn't believe that came out his mouth! 
After all said and done. I left very hungry and with an upset stomach just for eating some of the hard pasta.
So if you really want a good italian resturant. I suggest Pasta Mia across from the Palms, it's not on the strip per say but if you want some good italian good this is your place. Its authentic and delicious! Oh and very afforable!

Made a reservation for 6:30, tables were empty and they still made us wait. We sat at the bar and everything we asked for, they we're out of. Finally sat down, service was just okay. Food did not have flavor... I ordered the pasta with seafood and the pasta was not fresh. Shrimp were okay. Clams had no taste.. my husband ordered the sea bass and it was just bland... Will not go there again. Food is over priced. Save yourself money and go to the buffet instead.

It is more an experience than great food.  The risotto was crunchy and disappointing.  It's average Italian food, not great.  The wine somnelier was very helpful though in helping us select a great wine.  All in all, unless we just went for drinks, we would not return.

I have eaten here about 5 times... the food is ALWAYS amazing.... get the cheesesteak and the scallops are as good as it gets
however, this last trip there was much better due tothe AMAZING SERVICE we received by Ray and Francisco! we were a large group and they were rock stars! Thank you!

Excellent food!  Everything is made fresh. Raymond and Francisco gave us outstanding service. We found this restaurant when we were in Fort Lauderdale and loved it!!  So glad we found it here in Las Vegas!  Will definitely recommend!!!
This is by far the best ItAlian restaurant.  The service was impeccable and the food was the best. I recommend it very highly.

Attended a Birthday party at this restaurant.  One of the best experiences we had in Vegas on this trip.  Home style Italian food, like your mother or grandmother made.  Service was exceptional as was the Sommelier.  Only negative is the location in the Paris Hotel.  Definitely worth the trek through the lobby/casino area.

We truly enjoyed our dinner here. Our pasta dishes were full of flavor and freshness. My husband had Bucatini Carbonara a house specialty. Neither one of us had ever tasted anything like it. Needless to say he cleaned his plate and thoroughly enjoyed this meal. I had the Fusilli Pollo this was delisious. It does have a strong bell pepper flavor something im not used to in my pasta. Our waiter took on the style of the resturant making small tall with us. It was nice to enjoy a different dinning experience with different dishes. We eat out alot and it can get boring. So this was a refreshing fun evening. Oh you must top it ofc with the carrot cake, it is out of this world.

Martoranos.  This was the toughest review to write from my last trip, and not sure I'll convey what happened in this review but I'll try.

We visited the new location in the Paris Las Vegas hotel on 10/21/14.  We had walked by it during the day, thought it looked cool...liked the menu...so researched it a bit while sitting at the pool and decided that we had to go, seeing how SO MANY celebs and notable people ranked Chef Martorano's food SO high!  So we were pretty excited to check it all out and enjoy a great meal.

We were seated on time at a table on the 'outside' of the restaurant, so we didn't get that movies on the wall, disco ball in the center kind of experience...but did enjoy the al fresco style dining and people watching in the Paris shops area.

Right next to us was a group of 8 conventioneers, who were a bit loud from time to time and seemed to dominate the service as you will see below.

We were greeted by Georgio (hope I spelled that right) after a good 5-10 minutes of perusing the menu on our own.  He dropped off an iPad with the drink menu, took our "flat or sparkling" water order, and explained the specials for the night, which I took note of a seafood selection that he described as a "seafood party in your mouth"...something about that was both comical and odd...not sure why though.  We quickly found out that the iPad was malfunctioning, if you pressed on anything it would just freeze.  So we were unable to check out any kind of special drink selection (we were thinking martini style special followed by some wine with dinner).  Georgio then became a bit occupied with pouring wine for the conventioneers so we were able to flag down his 'assistant' Jason (I think he was an assistant, or in training or something) who quickly brought us a new iPad.  Georgio then came back and took our order...not asking if we'd like to start with an appetizer, not asking if we'd like a drink, but simply saying "are you ready to order"...which led to her saying "yeah I want the martini, the seafood special..." him looking at me so i had to say "I want a Manhattan up with Makers, we're splitting the eggplant parm and I'll take the Buitoni Meatball"...just not how you serve a couple in a high end establishment.

So then another 10 minutes passed.  The restaurant was about 70% full and the bar was not busy.  We had no drinks and had been sitting there for a total of 25 minutes.  Jason kept looking and then came over to say "didn't you guys order drinks?" to which he promptly went to the bar and resolved..bringing us our drinks moments later.

Our eggplant parm arrived shortly thereafter and I have to say it was AWESOME!!  Probably the best I've had..and was a perfect size to split with a date.

After clearing the plates and then taking a wine order (glasses, not a full bottle) the night seemed to be moving more smoothly....until the entrees.

My entree came out but her food did not.  Jason was kind enough to explain that the food was all cooked fresh to order and sent as soon as it was ready, that they didn't hold anything in the kitchen.  Ok, I'm cool with that.  But who knew a buitoni (think thick linguini) and meatball cooked 5-10 minutes quicker than some seafood (clams, shrimp, etc..seafood party) over linguni?  Throughout this whole process, Jason was super attentive to our needs and seemed to really try and keep things going...while Georgio was busy trying to be cool, pouring drinks for the big convention table, and coming up with cheezy Italian style lines to say to everyone.

The manager actually came over and apologized, and first offered another glass of wine (which we both had a full glass) so we declined..then said "well, just pick out a desert and we'll take care of it for you"...seemed to me a nice gesture and the right thing to do.

Her food finally came out and I do have to say we both LOVED our meals.  I had the best friggin' meatball ever and she had an awesome seafood dish.  The food at this place is worth every penny of the price.

Jason continued to check in on us, making sure things were going smooth...while Georgio continued posturing for everyone.  Ever see a person who thinks he's a special gift to everyone, and has no clue he is actually really cheesy and borderline annoying?  Anyway...

We went on to split a desert (thinking this was on the house)...tiramisu.  Now, I'm not even a fan of tiramisu but holy smokes..it was AWESOME!!

We were then brought the bill...which of course did not have the desert or anything comped...but at that point we didn't really want to make a big deal and just settled up.  

Funny that on our way out, we asked to have our photo taken and who stepped up?  Yep, Jason!  We thanked him for taking care of us all night and actually tipped him separate, fearful that the tip on the bill would all go to Georgio.  My hope is that if anyone from the restaurant reads this, GIVE JASON A PROMOTION!  He was outstanding!!

Food: 5  Georgio: 2  Jason: 5  Mgr: 1

Worst Service Ever.
I was with 3 friends and we decided to check this place out.  We were thinking we would have drinks and maybe see.  When we didn't order food right away the waiter obviously got upset.  Suddenly the manager was there asking if we were going to be eating.  We said we just wanted a drink we thought.  He told us the tables were reserved for people who were going to eat.  I looked around and there was maybe 2 or 3 other tables with people at them.  One of my friends began to protest but I was just in such shock I said let's go.  The manager said he was sorry.  No he wasn't.  Don't be rude AND lie to me.  We went to the French restaurant in the Paris and had a wonderful meal and spent over $200.  The service was wonderful.  Martorano's is not friendly.  The food may be good but I'll never get to find out because I was asked to leave.

What restaurant tells you very short and plainly you cannot have any sauce on the side...being Diabetic less sauce is best and our waiter would not even ask kitchen!!

No service which seems to explain low reviews.

Bread good, salad good....

My husband & I were walking around in the Paris Hotel & we had reservation at another restaurant, but after seeing the menu & the wonderful story of Steve Martorano, we wanted to dine here.  We sat at the bar u til our table was ready & the bartender was great she was so efficient & nice.  We were seated at Yuri's section & he was absolutely amazing.  Yuri was very knowledgeable of hr menu, food, taste etc & proudly would say I've been with this great restaurant for almost 10 years.  We had a wonderful dinner, just simply the BEST of all the choices in Vegas to dine, guess what we came back the next night asking to be seated at Yuri's table.  He remembered us, our drinks, dinners & what else we had looked at the previous night to eat.  It was AMAZING, please Mr. Steve Martorano open a restaurant here in Los Angeles please Malibu

Just went here last night for fight weekend and I was extremely disappointed. Nice venue, nice atmosphere, and good service but the food quality was not up to par. First off getting your food takes forever because everything is "made fresh daily". My husband ordered the carbonara which honestly just tasted like a fancy mac & cheese. I ordered the lasagna and I can honestly say I've had much better lasagna frozen from Costco. In addition the risotto we ordered was way over salted. Overall way overpriced for the quality and taste of the food. Save your money and go elsewhere.

I have been trying to reproduce this meatball for a while. Steve claims to give you the scoop on ingredients and the how to via several youtube videos. But alas there are holes (intentional) in his instruction. I don't blame him and yah, the damn meatball is that good!

The next time your walking the strip and are looking for a light meal and a drink, drop in to Paris, plop your butt on a barstool at Martorano's and order a nice glass of red and the Meatball Salad. Trust me.

This may be a little biased- I grew up on Italian food from a mother who was the most amazing cook. The food in my neighborhood was what we referred to as "red sauce" or "italian-american". Martorano's took his east coast-italian american food that we all grew up on and brought it to Vegas- and good for him. There is an entire population in Vegas who never had this. I should know, I was there Saturday night with 2 very "American" friends from California. They LOVED it. Their review would be 5 stars all the way. I just have had this food so much that it is not unique. Strictly local red sauce grub. I had to explain what "gravy" was to my friends - which was pretty funny. I also had to hold my tongue at the "mark-up" of Proseco ($15 I pay at the market - $40 at Martorano's) - They gave us a nice tasting of mortadella mouse- it was very tasty. I had the linguine vongoli. I thought it was really good. They are very generous with the clams. Usually, you get such a small amount. Very good meal. My friends got the pasta with fish and liked it and my other friend LOVED the eggplant stack and satueed spinach. Good restaurant for Las Vegas

Martorano's couldn't care less about you - it's all about the 'thug' attitude of Steve Martorano who believes the food is better than reality. The staff has nothing good to say about him.

At the Paris hotel, I had a diabetic blood sugar crash. After starting to recover, I was escorted by the EMS of Paris Hotel to the nearest restaurant with the desire of getting simple carbs into my system. Slumped in a chair and sweating profusely, I had to deal with extensive discussions until the manager finally stated that he refused to let me order anything except exactly what was on the menu. It went so far that I requested a pasta dish from the menu and asked that no "gravy" be put on the pasta . . . but charge me full price. "Absolutely Not" was the response. It was stated many times that Mr. Martorano does not care about my issues and refuses to make any alterations to any of their dishes - regardless of circumstance. Period.

Aside from this inhumane treatment and outrageous behavior, I was forced to eat Martorano's pasta dish prepared according to 'Steve's' menu requirement. I'm an Italian from New York, my grand parents were from Italy and operated a successful catering business after immigrating to the United States. I know Italian food. I cook and have spent 33 years in the food industry myself, and let me tell you, this food is not authentic Italian. Bread is the most basic aspect of an Italian meal and it should be outstanding. Martorano's bread was absolutely horrible: dry, tasteless and without texture. No kidding, the best part of my meal was the water.  

Even if the food had been good, which it was not, how can people tolerate supporting an individual who is so egocentric that he would rather see a patron in distress suffer than serve a pasta dish without his precious "gravy" slathered on top. The tone of everything Martorano is negative, offensive, insulting and stinks of a pompous individual who would rather intimidate his customers and staff than be a beloved restaurateur. Steve Martorano needs to grow up and respect the people that spend their hard-earned money on his over-priced, mediocre food served with an attitude.  "YO CUZ"!!!!!

The only thing that saves this place is the chicken parmigiano. The best I've ever tasted,  but just know it is served by itself, no sides. Spaghetti noodles were thick and very good as well. The meatball was average. Gnocchi - a waste, I've had much better. 

First, decor was nice but really doesn't match the Paris Hotel feel. 

Our waiter Mark...ugh...the only time he became somewhat "attentive/friendly" was when he realized we started questioning the bill and asked for his name. He was nowhere near friendly right from the start. When I asked if there was a kids menu he said no in a condescending tone, like I was asking a foolish question.  A more professional response would be "I'm so sorry, no we do not." He asked if we wanted wine.  When a few  (but not all) of us said no, he walked away while my father was still deciding what to get. When my mom said it was my birthday he dismissed it right away but then said a brief ("I really dont care" tone) "happy birthday" when she repeated it. Also, it was disheartening to see what I think was the manager (heavier set older caucasian man) check on everyone's table except for ours. The only pleasant person was our busser. The host at the entrance wasn't as friendly too.

For their HIGH prices (27-62 per plate) and "fancier/upscale" dining we expected more. Shame on you for having worse service than the Applebees down the street from my home. We eat at a lot of classy restaurants but this was truly one of the most disappointing places. Please do not even waste your time.

Great place to stop by the bar for a quick bite and a martini when on the strip. I tried the meatball salad and they do a great job creating a tender meatball. Friendly, attentive service too. Will have to stop by again on my next trip to Bally's or Paris.

Went for a late night dinner at the bar. It was a gorgeous and large space, sexy, open, low lighting.No blaring music, it was kept at a low-moderate volume. You can sit toward's the front or the restaurant and watch people pass by or toward's the back for more intimacy. 

We ordered off the late night menu.
-Caesar's salad was one of very best I've ever had.
-Pizza was okay; fabulous thin crust but the cheese was...weak, flavorless.
-Good wine list. I was debating wines and the bartender immediately bought me four to taste based on my stated preferences. 
-I went big and had a couple glasses of the Brunello di Montelcino $24/glass. They also had a super Tuscan.

This is one of my favorite Italian restaurants. Service was wonderful. We were really impressed by the freshness and flavors of all the food. Our pasta carbonara was decadent. Cocktails were great and there was a fun atmosphere in the restaurant. We really enjoyed our visit and look forward to returning.
Wonderful salad! So tangy and just perfect with a side of spaghetti. Service on point at the bar. Our bartender allowed us to taste a couple of wines...our favorite touch. Paris!

Meatball salad appetizer is incredible. Anything with the Sunday gravy (marinara) is worth getting. Veal picatta had a great sauce with a perfect texture. Chicken Parmesan was the best I've had. Wait staff are helpful and prompt. Worth trying.

I ordered what i thought was the sauce that had everything in it with pasta without looking at the menu and I got something totally different that had fat chunks of stringy pork. Was a bad experience as the manager didn't care at all. I went last month and ate with my Diamond preferred total rewards card and the food was great, they gave me a totally different meal and all i can say is i won't be back. Small portions, unfriendly manager.

First time eating here....and...LOVED IT. There are so many dining options in Vegas- but we will return here!

The service was great.   Our waiter was extremely friendly and attentive. 

I love the fact that they show you pictures of the specials. We had the pork chop special and the sea bass with lump crab meat. Outstanding!  They make their own mozzarella and it was wonderful. 

Great experience!

First visit, I arrived as they were opening @ 4:30pm. Ordered meatball & salad. $20, one Meatball was good but not enough sauce., salad had to much dressing and only had lettuce and tomato. Waiter service was okay. Pricy.

I went here with a friend. The food was so good. It reminded me of the type of italian food i used to eat on the east coast. It was fresh and tasty. The only areas that could use a little improvement was the time it took for the order t come out and the presentation of the veal. Other than that this is the place to go for real " Sunday Gravy" and good food. It is a bit unassuming when you walk by. However, you need to stop! go in and try the food. I reco the cheesesteak sandwich and the meatball salad. A very generous and flavorful salad accompanies a gigantic meatball and plenty of ricotta cheese. The gravy is flavorful and good. 

On the veal, i would have dressed it up with some gravy over the top of it and some fresh basil and oregano to give it some depth and color. The taste was good. It was tender and not chewy. 

Will i be back, ABSOLUTELY!!!  Already booked a party there. 

PS they have tis all around the rest. We were having a terrific meal whilst watching the God Father.  Cannot get better than that!!

It was ok overall. It's pretty and crisp and has good energy BUTTT they do NO SUBSTITUTES... Meaning you cannot even add chicken to your Cesar salad!!!! You can not substitute your favorite pasta. They cook al Dante but I prefer mine a little over cooked and softer, the ends on some strands were out right hard. But my carbonara sauce was delicious. But I was just especially disappointed that we couldn't add chicken to a salad!!!!!

This is seriously the only good thing we experienced at Paris. We were so disappointed with everything else, but this saved our evening there.

We didn't order anything to eat, but we came in for a drink at the bar and were pleasantly surprised. The bartenders were super nice, attentive, and knowledgable about their selections. It was nice being able to chat a bit about the different wines they carried and they offered me a few to try based on my preferences. We were impressed.

The decor is interesting with blue lighting and very modern. Not exactly what I'd expect from an Italian restaurant. We came in on a Sunday evening and it wasn't too busy. We were greeted right away when we stepped up and got a seat at the bar. The bartender came over right away to help us.

Although I don't see us ever staying at the Paris Hotel again, if we were in the area and wanted to grab a drink, we would totally come back here. I'd even be open to trying it out for dinner.

I wasn't sure what to expect when I sat down last night, it officially opens this weekend so we were sampling it pre-grand opening. We had fantastic service and the food was incredible! If you're looking for a great authentic Italian meal--THIS IS IT!

I liked the ambiance of restaurant blue light accenting the walls, pictures in black and white (one of the owner), tvs on walls playing movies with subtitles on, and music going. The menus are electronic, a little heavy.  But each table got an ipad that displayed drinks (wine list, cocktails), daily specials. It was very high tech!
This is the second time we've dined here. The first time was in Harrahs in Atlantic City and it did not disappoint ! Paul out server over at the Las Vegas location was awesome! Im so stuffed!
Food was excellent. Server took good care of us.  A bit pricey,  but it was a special occasion.  We would definitely come back when in Vegas again.

This place I have passed by any of trips to Las Vegas, decided to go and it was fantastic, from the waiter Paul & his busser Charles they were very helpful to make our dinner & nite memorable, the food was delicious from the caprese salad right down to the chicken permagian, we will definitely be back again.

I was stationed in Sicily for three years. I love carbonara and ate it all over Italy.  I'm not sure where the chef learned how to make it but it couldn't of been in Italy. It was an extremely heavy thick dish. It should be much lighter. It just sat in my stomach all night.  The manager came by and asked how we enjoyed our half eaten meal. I told him the truth and he had nothing to say and just walked away. I guess they only want to hear compliments. Definitely will not return. Even the waiter had an attitude. I will say the bread was pretty good though.

I have waited two weeks after eating at Martorano's to write this review, in order to take some of the emotion out of my review.  I left there disappointed, because I like Paris Las Vegas so much.  But if you're looking for Italian in Las Vegas, you can do so much better.

It was fairly simple to get a reservation the same day.  People on walk-up at 8PM were told about a 45-minute wait which, on a holiday weekend in Vegas, still seemed reasonable.  Greeter staff was nice.  

Our server was polite, but was very busy in another part of the restaurant.  We waited almost 10 minutes after ordering drinks to get them, and it was only because our assistant waiter (the busboy) saw us looking around, and was alert enough to ask if there was a problem.

Martorano's boasts about their meatballs.  The meatballs get lots of hype.  And the meatball appetizer is OK, but not life-changing.  If you've ever eaten in Little Italy in any city, or at a decent Italian restaurant anywhere that makes its own meatballs as opposed to using those from their foodservice, you'll think the same.  The presentation is nice, but for $20, I expected more from a meatball.  

The food was very good.  Please don't mistake the tone of my review, accentuated by what happened when ordering, for putting down their food.  It's pricey, but it's The Strip.  I had Veal Parmigiana which came with NOTHING for $42. 

My problem came when I tried to order a side dish.  I wanted a side of pasta, but too much tomato is a very bad thing for me, and I was already having it in the veal. The waiter knew this, because I asked for very light sauce with the veal.    I asked if they could do the pasta with just butter or oil and garlic - very simple, staple ingredients in any restaurant kitchen, let alone an Italian kitchen.  I was told NO, right away.  No discussion.  The restaurant has a firm "no substitutions" policy.  I explained to the waiter that it was something akin to a food allergy, and he told me there was nothing he could do.  The answer was NO.  So I asked just for some plain spaghetti, no sauce.  I was going to be sneaky and just take the butter from the bread and put it on the pasta.  Guess they were two steps ahead of me, because that wasn't allowed either.  I was going to take the spaghetti with marinara and LIKE IT!  OK - no side dish.  And, it's not as though Tomato was going to kill me.  I wasn't going into shock...just some discomfort.  But, no dice.

The waiter sensed my displeasure, and the GM appeared later.  He apologized for not being able to accommodate my wishes.  He told me that the chef had full control over the kitchen, and he was adamant about there being no changes and no substitutions for anything on the menu.  I asked to speak to the chef, but was told "Oh, he's not here, he's in Dallas...but he reads feedback comments you leave when you sign your check".  For the record, as polite as my comments were, he never responded.

It was simply the most ridiculous thing I've ever heard of.  Celebrity Chefs everywhere make accommodations for guest requests that aren't outrageous. I mean, I wasn't asking them to make me gluten-free pasta.  

We ate our entrees - which were good.  Nothing memorable, but good.  We skipped dessert and coffee.

The heavy word:  There are WAY TOO MANY CHOICES for great Italian in Las Vegas - and within a 10 minute walk of this place - for any restaurant to be less-than-accommodating.  I'm not saying you won't have a good meal here; but you can do better.
Great place for amazing food as always. Thanks to Steve for bringing this restaurant from Florida to Vegas.
Service was great. The tomato mozzarella starter was wonderful. All 3 main meals were below average. There are much better Italian restaurants in Vegas and for half the price.

Definite 5 stars plus! Great food. Exceptional service. I had the meatball mozzarella appetizer and a dessert and I was stuffed. The server was knowledgeable and very pleasant. Convenient location right outside of the Paris hotel. The movies that were played made dining feel like I was at home. Beautiful decor as well.

This is supposed to be a fine dining restaurant however..... Do not expect to change one single thing on the menu, even if you have food allergies.  Too bad! Sorry for your luck!  Don't even ask for salt!  They will not even put the sauce in the side!!!! Eggplant stack was delicious, so was the mozzarella appetizer.   The pasta bolognese was over priced and was not worthy of a fine dining restaurant.  Yo cuz!  Get with the times,  people make changes to the food based on allergies and so that they can enjoy your food, you need to understand that and give a little on this harsh policy!.

Nice atmosphere, excellent service, food was much better than I expected...I recommend ordering the meatball and salad combo; one their signature dishes, My wife ordered a cabanara dish that was just right...I had a pasta and meat dish that was delicious, would definitely visit another Martorano's
Place is empty and the they told me there is nothing available...dah i can see all the tables are empty

Staff was very friendly and helpful with the menu. We sat on what would be the outside. We ordered what they call family share appetizers. It basically came with five full size appetizers but you only pick three. We had the salad, calamari, and meatballs. Just amazing. All three tasted great. I wanted gnocchi for dinner. So I had to order an entree in order to get that as a side. Turns out gnocchi is only a side not an entree. No you cannot order it alone. The gnocchi was big enough for a meal. I took my entree to go. Just remember...no substitutions allowed! But seriously great place and food. I definitely want to eat here again.

Italian food was tasty but alittle too spicy on some things ordered. Chicken had sauce alittle too spicy as well as my spinach. If you like spicy this is the place for you. I don't think I will come back here

This dude Steve Martorano knows his way around the kitchen.  I first visited his Ft. Lauderdale location a couple of years ago, and I ate there twice in one weekend.  I love Italian food and if you do too, do yourself a favor and check this place out. 

This was my first visit to the Paris Las Vegas location, and it did not disappoint.  We started with the Homemade Mozzarella with olive oil and sea salt and it just melts in your mouth.  Then I had the Martorano Salad which was popping with veggies, something I love.  For dinner, I went with the Veal Cutlet Martorano which is topped with San Marzano tomatoes and this dish has an amazing combination of sweet and hot that balances your taste buds perfectly.  The table also split the Bucatini Carbonara, which is full of creamy goodness and the pasta is amazingly fresh.  

This guy knows Italian food and he is a big guy so the portions are quite large.  I see a lot of people on this site reviewing this place as too pricey and that could not be further from the truth.  Each dish contains large portions, even the salads, so pack an appetite.  If you're looking for a $10 Chicken Parmesan, go to Olive Garden, this place is not for you.

I came here expecting this place to be over rated and it turned out to be some of the best Italian that I've ever had. Best in Las Vegas. The seafood spaghetti had so much flavor that just a tiny taste of the sauce had punch. The appetizers are divine, great vegetarian options and the dishes tasted traditional and homemade. I loved it and can't wait to go back.

I did find a hair in my red velvet cake and they accidentally gave me someone else's doggy bag but the food was so good I'm willing to overlook it. LOL!
Delish!!! Top notch service and food. The meatball is to die for and can't complain about the chicken parmigiana, calamari or gnocchi either.
Raymond was awesome!!! Really good food and service! I got the carbonara mhhhhm goooood!

Great service from beginning to end. We started with an appetizer called Fried Calamari Bibzy which is out of this world delicious!!!  We ordered the Spaghetti Pescatore and the Spaghetti D.O.P. - both were very delicious!!!

Let me say the review has nothing to do with the food. Been to the one at rio food was awesome service just as good atmosphere amazing. 

Service at Paris horrible and slow. They had no personality, just not friendly.  Waited for service a long time then no interaction at all, very different from Rio. 

Food. I ordered exactly the same items as last time. Meatball and salad. It was the same, delicious. Bread with oil very good. Spaghetti Dob also very good. 

Atmosphere....none there were tons of empty tables inside the restaurant where the theme and atmosphere are yet they sat us on top of a huge party outside in the walkway to hear and see all the drunks walk by, so no atmosphere on the patio....again way different than the cool setting at the Rio with Rocky movies and music.
